column1: back of a length outside off, moves away a long distance off the pitch. Left alone
good length, angled in this time but no movement outside off. Left alone
marginal movement away from a fuller length, but too far outside off to be played at
back of a length outside off, jags back in towards the corridor. Climbs through to the keeper as he shoulders arms
angled in outside off at a length, shapes away very late. Still no shot offered
length outside off stump, doesn't go after it. Left alone
goes wide of the crease and swings it away. But it's full and too far away for the batsman to play
wide of the crease, back of a length. Slight bend away in the corridor. Defended with barely any feet

lovely shot. Got the shape from wide of the crease, Roach, so he went for what bowlers call the magic ball. Trying to swing it away from a full length on middle stump, but this goes through with the angle. He offers the full face of the bat and taps it past the non-striker to beat mid-on
back of a length outside off, straight through this time, to the keeper
back of a length wide outside off, left alone
length and angled in towards the corridor, doesn't cover the off stump as he lets this go
short of a length, wide outside off stump. Left alone
length outside off stump, climbs a touch, but once more it's too far away from the batsman
good length, wide outside off stump. Left alone

thinks about poking at one but lets it go at the last moment. Teasing line from Gabriel this time. Goes wide of the crease and slants it in towards the corridor on a good length. Draws him forward but can't get him to play at it still
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off stump, left alone. Some shape away after angling in
back of a length and looping slightly away from off stump. Drives away from the body with no feet, off the outside half of the bat as it climbs on him. Finds point
short and wide outside off, more in control as he goes for the cut this time. But point leaps to his left to field this on the bounce
overpitched just outside off stump, a firm drive back down the pitch. Straight at the bowler

gets him! Caught behind. Roach's persistence has worked. Kept swinging it away from wide of the crease and finally found the movement away from the stumps. This was headed for off, went away just the perfect amount. The angle had already drawn a shot from Mire - but it was only hands. The front leg was nowhere. Healthy edge, taken low to the right by Dowrich
back of a length outside off, climbs to waist height for the keeper as the batsman lets it go
good length outside off stump, left alone
well bowled. Slants into the corridor at a drive-able length, nips away off the seam. But Masakadza is all patience today. Covers his off stump, lets it go
back of a length in the channel, draws a nervous looking defensive shot off the back foot. Inside edge, tangled in between his legs
classy. A solid start from Masakadza today, he's been very patient. Gets a perfectly overpitched ball outside off as reward, minimal foot movement needed as he drives to the cover boundary
length outside off stump, left alone
oh beauty! Good length, angled in at off stump, nips away as he pokes at it with no feet. Beaten on the outside edge. That is the perfect Test ball
oh this is glorious Test cricket today. This one has the seam pointing away, but it keeps hooping back in from outside off and just climbs over off stump as he lets it go
good length outside off stump, this time he's tentative about the leave. No feet, pushes into the off side with hard hads
back of a length in the corridor, watchfully left alone
good length, swinging in towards the corridor. Defended into the off side with soft hands, from right under his eyes
back of a length, middle and off line. Tapped into the leg side from the crease

good length outside off stump, puts in a stride and drives on the rise. Not quite off the middle, but there's only one fielder in front of the stumps on the off side. Trickles towards the cover boundary

clean bowled! Superb stuff from West Indies' opening bowlers. This wicket was set up by Roach - Ervine is no anxious as this comes towards him. Angled in from a good length. No stride and gap between bat and pad. Unlike Roach, Gabriel doesn't take it away. Slants into him and cuts through his defence to send leg stump cartwheeling break middle stump in half
good length, angled in at off stump. Pushes in front of his body to get this defensive shot down the pitch
good length in the corridor, belated foot movement forward but he gets behind the line to defend on the front foot
closer to the stumps as he delivers this. Full and just outside off. He looks to stab it through the off side, gets it off the inside half and it rolls to wide mid-on's left
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off stump, covers the off stump to let it go
good length and in the corridor, defended into the off side, close to his body
oh close to the off stump. Slants in from a length. Lets it go on the front foot
back of a length, hint of shape away. Pushed into the covers on the up
back of a length just outside off stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot

raps him in front of off stump as he plonks the front leg across to defend. Not out says the umpire for the lbw appeal. Roach says no to the review, signalling that it might have been going over. Replays confirm it would have been umpire's call. Just clipping the top of leg stump
short of a length outside off stump, pushed through the point region on the up. Did well to get on top of the bounce
back of a length, wide outside off stump. Left alone
good length, angled in, tails away at the last moment along with some lift off the pitch. Left alone
length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
good length, in at off stump. Very late on this defence. Squeezes down the pitch off the inside half of the bat
back of a length at off stump. Defended into the leg side off the inside half of the bat

chops it on! More nerves from Zimbabwe! Only one batsman has looked assured today, but he's at the non-strikers end as Roach angles another one into a tight line outside off. It's a forward defence ball for Taylor if he isn't batting in the 10th over with two wickets down. But the stride is short, the intent to play is half-baked and the result is disastrous for Zimbabwe. Deflects it onto the stumps
good length and in at off stump. Nervous prod from the crease. Thick inside edge down to fine leg
first leg stump ball of the bat. Back of a length and in the his hips. He tucks it to fine leg's left
back of a length outside off stump, left alone

shot. A nice-looking, confident straight drive past the bowler. Fuller length at off stump, stands tall and offers the full face as he drives. Slow outfield though, would have been four in most grounds
back of a length at leg stump, shovelled into the leg side on the up
manages to flick it off the inside edge. Length ball headed for middle stump. He's late on the shot. But safe in the end. More so down at the non-strikers end as fine leg cleans up
back of a length outside off, squeezed through point off the back foot
good length outside off stump, left alone on the front foot
full outside off stump, drives on the up. Straight to extra cover
slower ball from back of the hand, looped full outside off. 103 kph. Watchfully tapped to mid-off

gully leaps to his left as this loops up off Masakadza's shoulder. Takes the catch. He was looking to hook but was late on it. Sounded like an inside edge. Umpire says not out. West Indies review. Masakadza walks as soon as they do....but he has over-stepped! Oh dear. It was such a good bouncer, climbing at an off stump. Masakadza was looking to pull on the front foot. Inside edged it onto his back shoulder. Exasperation in the West Indies dressing room
speared very full and attacking the stumps, Hamilton jams it to mid-on

Roach ventures wide of the crease - as he often does - he gets this full delivery to hold its line in the channel outside off. Moor wafts away from the body, and watches the inside edge wander away to the leg side
good length and angling in on off from over the wicket, defended to silly point
slightly overpitched on off stump, Hamilton drills a drive straight back at the bowler. Roach bends in his followthrough and parries the ball away to mid-on
rare loose ball from Roach. Short and wide outside off, Hamilton skips back and muscles a cut to the left of short cover. The ball races away
pitched up and slanting in at off, defended to silly point again

Roach finds the outside edge.... but it does not carry to Dowrich behind the stumps. Wide of the crease, angled in just outside off, straightens away late to catch the outside edge but the ball dies in front of the keeper. Credit to the batsman for employing soft hands
floated full and wide  - wider than a set of stumps outside off - no shot
wide of the crease, short and holds its line outside off, Moor rises on top of the bounce. He has ample time to do so. Lashed away to the off-side sweeper
floated full and much closer to the off stump, Hamilton flashes a drive and inside-edges it behind to the keeper. Hamilton living dangerously
good length and angling in on middle, much tighter drive to mid-on
Hamilton leans back to meet this shortish ball outside off. He opens the face and guides it to the left of sweeper cover with a slicing finish. Smart placement from the big man
short on top of off, stands tall and forces the ball straight to mid-off
good length and holds its line in the channel, left alone outside off
back of a length and angling into off, solidly pushed to the covers off the front foot
pitched up and inviting the drive outside off, the batsman does not bite
good length and slanting down the leg side, all it needed was a little tickle. Moor can't put bat on ball, however
pitched up and just a shade outside off, Moor check-drives it back to the bowler
good length on a fifth-stump line outside off, ignored
just short of a good length and outside off, Blackwood offers no pace. Hamilton can't manufacture his own pace. Jabbed to mid-off
overpitched and outside off, presses forward and muscles a drive straight to cover
back of a length and on the hips, camps back and swats the ball away to midwicket
full and wide outside off, the batsman leans into a drive and finds cover
Blackwood goes wide of the crease again. Short and sticks in the pitch, check-punched to cover from outside off
good length and heading towards off stump, Hamilton hangs back and stops it in its tracks
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Moor has nothing to do with it
full and floated down the leg side, Moor still can't connect with the leg glance
good length and nibbles back in, close to off, but it isn't coming back in enough to clip off. Left alone carefully
back of a length and outside off, no shot again
Holder keeps hitting that back of a length outside off, Moor keeps leaving
pitched up and outside off, Moor isn't close enough to the pitch of the ball, but squirts a drive through the gap at cover
full and floated through outside off, ignored
back of a length and just a shade outside off, jabbed straight to mid-off

Umpire Fry is in the firing line. The ball flies off the top of the bails at the non-striker's end, and hits Fry on the side of the hat. He is fine, as is Moor, who had grounded his bat by the time the bowler deflected it back onto the stumps. This was full on the stumps, drilled back to Blackwood, who stretches his right hand and tips it to the furniture
picked off the hips to the right of midwicket
full and outside off, left alone
good length on off - not quite full enough for the drive - Hamilton stands tall and stabs it back to the bowler
Moor sizes up this short, wide ball and scythes a cut in the air over backward point. He saw the width, and simply freed his arms
pitched up and angling into a pretty-looking drive straight past the left of the bowler
good length and angling into off, Moor covers up in defence
impressive bouncer, angling in, heading towards the head. Moor has his eyes locked on it before swaying out of the way. Replays show the ball brushed the shoulder and looped to the keeper
Moor loves width outside off. He leans back and crisply punches it to the left of backward point. The fielder slides at the edge of the boundary and limits it to two
chest-high short ball on middle, well directed, and equally well played. Moor rises with it and pats it down like a gamboling puppy
Hamilton punches this short ball outside off with a high elbow but can't get it past cover
full and on off stump, Hamilton check-drives down the ground and secures a single
back of length and outside off, Moor drives early and skewers it to cover
Moor hangs his bat out to this full ball that seams away past the outside edge. No feet from the batsman
Moor now presses forward and tightly defends this length ball from outside off to cover
pitched up on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, no shot
Holder uses his height and finds extra bounce outside off, but Hamilton does not chase this delivery in the channel
good length and holds its line outside off, Hamilton protects his off stump and shoulders arms
Hamilton rises on top of the bounce of this short ball outside off and punches to the left of backward point. Hetmyer, the sub fielder, throws himself to his left to stop the ball
attempted bouncer outside off - barely rises upto the chest - he sways out of the way
hip-high short ball outside off, Hamilton goes on the back foot and pulls a single to Chase at deep midwicket
Moor thought about having a waft at this full dart outside off before belatedly pulling his bat away from the line
pitched up and outside off, left alone
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, Hamilton gets right behind the line in defence
back of a length and homing in on off, Hamilton drops it defensively to the off side
half-volley outside off, Hamilton  latches onto it, stretching out and crunnnnnnnching a drive to the left of short cover
pitched up and holding its line outside off, no shot
full and angling into a strong front-foot defence
good length and holds its line outside off, Moor hoists his bat above his shoulder and lets it go
short and slanted in, defended on off stump
nip-backer from Holder, but doesn't nip back in enough to pose a threat to the off stump. Well left alone in the channel
back of a length and angling in towards off stump, Moor plays with an angled bat as opposed to showing the full face, squirts an inside edge to the midwicket region
Hamilton covers his off stump and lets this length ball go outside off
Hamilton rises with this rising ball outside off and taps it down to the off side. Well negotiated
short and climbs outside off, Moor jumps off the ground and wafts it to the covers
darted full and wide outside off, Moor watches it through to the keeper
good length and outside off, no shot again
good length and speared outside off, left alone again
full and probes away outside off, Moor pushes out in the channel and watches the ball run past the outside edge
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and pats it to cover
just short of a good length and outside off, Hamilton flat-bats a pull past the right of midwicket
short on top of off, Hamilton stands tall and blocks to the covers
pitched up on middle, he unfurls a velvet-smooth drive but hits it straight to mid-on
good length and outside off, Holder generates extra bounce, no shot
a bit too full on off, jammed out to mid-off
hip-high short ball on off, Hamilton hangs back and swats it away to the right of deep midwicket
lobbed up really full and outside off, Moor squeezes a drive to the covers
loops another legbreak up outside off, driven to cover off the front foot again
slider outside off, no shot
pitched up and outside off, Moor stretches out and smothers it to the off side
grip, turn, and bounce! He lands it full on off, makes the batsman poke at it, and rips past the outside edge. Why didn't you introduce him earlier, Holder?
another tossed-up legbreak, starts outside off and spins away further. No shot
a full toss above waist height, middle stump line. Watchfully tucks it to fine leg
and he edges it through where third slip would, and you'd argue should, have been. Back of a length and climbing in the corridor. Cant get on top of the bounce as he stabs at this
length and slanting in from outside off, left alone
overpitched on off stump, balanced drive to mid-off
short ball into the body, swivels and ramps it towards fine leg
good length, just outside off stump. Left alone
good length and in at off stump. Defended solidly down the pitch
short and wide outside off. Spinning away a long way. He can only get the bottom of the bat on the cut
slider outside off stump, left alone
edge flies past second slip. A poor shot really. Ball is tossed up outside off, spinning well away. He's looked to hoick it over midwicket without getting to the pitch
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, rips past the outside edge as he stretches forward. A lot bounce too
full at leg stump, dead-batted down the pitch off the front foot
overpitched on leg stump, tapped through midwicket off the toe of the bat
back of a length outside off, stands tall to punch to sweeper cover's right
good length, angling in at the corridor. He looks to punch it through the covers on the up. Inside half of the bat, into the leg side
full at off stump, squirms it to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
back of a length in the corridor, defended solidly into the off side
full and in at off stump, inside edge onto pad as he looks to drive on the front foot
full outside off, plants a big stride outside off and looks to sweep. Under-edges it fine. Slip gives chase
back of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short and spinning wide of off, chopped to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, left alone
quicker one, back of a length outside off. Hurriedly slices to backward point
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side on the up
back of a length just outside off, left alone
back of a length just outside off, defends yet another one off the inside half of the bat. Not getting behind too many at the moment
short ball outside off, left alone
back of a length, lifting from a middle stump line.Thuds into his hip as he stabs in front of the body
good length outside off. Looks to drive against the angle, and it's another inside edge onto pad. Roach has his hands on his hips halfway as he stands halfway down the wicket
good length at off stump, forward defence
short and spinning away from off. Not fully in control of the cut. Squeezes it to backward point's left
good length at middle stump. Pushed into the leg side on the front foot
edge is well wide of slip. Pokes at this length ball outside off as it spins away from him
quicker and fuller, at off stump. Pushed to extra cover
short ball, wide outside off stump. Lets it go
good length in the corridor, defended into the off side
good length and just outside off. Not to the pitch after leaning in. Bunts it aerially through the covers
good length outside off, defended down the pitch
full and speared in at off stump. Defended to mid-off
good length outside off. No feet as he defends. Thick outside edge to point
good length outside off, defended solidly into the covers
back of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper off the back foot
short and wide outside off, can't beat cover point with the cut
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short and wide outside off, nails the cut again, but finds cover point
good length just outside off, left alone as it spins past his front pad
length outside off, left alone
back of a length just outside off, left alone
short ball, climbing up at off stump. Watches it so well to play the pull. Supreme placement to beat fine leg and deep square. Top class shot in a top class innings so far - 8th Test fifty
short ball outside off, drops the arms this time and lets go
close. Length ball nips back in from a length and climbs over off stump as he lets it go
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to mid-on
good length, wide outside off. Lets it go on the front foot
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
short and wide outside off, cut straight to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-off
full at off stump, tapped back down the pitch off the inside half
good length outside off, left alone
smack. Poor ball. Very very short outside off and the spin doesn't a difference. So much time to bring the pull shot down at this and send it over the midwicket boundary
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length on middle stump, clipped to midwicket on the up
glorious shot. Overpitched outside off stump. Leans into the square drive and squeezes it between point and cover
good length and in at off stump. Solidly defended to extra cover
short ball in the corridor. Sways away and drops his wrists to let it pass
full outside off stump, mistimed cover drive to extra cover
full and just outside off. Pushed down the pitch off the inside half
good length at off stump. Defended off the inside half
short ball outside off, crunched wide of mid-off from the back foot
masterful shot. Back of a length at middle stump, spinning away from off. But he gets deep in the crease, goes against the turn and gets under the ball to whip it wide of mid-on
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, nips back in off the seam and just evades off stump
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length just outside off, punched into the off side off the outside half
full and just outside off. Firm punch to mid-off's right
back of a length at off stump, defends off the inside half of the bat, into the boot
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
yorker at middle stump. Squeezes it back past the bowler
good length outside off, no feet. Stabs into the covers on the up
good length outside off stump, left alone
overpitched outside off. Short stride to squeeze it to point's right
superb. Overpitched just outside off, driven cleanly past mid-off
back of a length outside off, punched towards mid-off from the crease
good length, starts outside off and wobbles away further, left alone
fuller than a good length and this one largely holds its line outside off, ignored in the channel
chest-high short ball, slanted in on middle and leg, cramps 'em up for room, the batsman hops and fends off to the leg side
good length and angling in, Hamilton shuffles forward and across, bunting the ball down to mid-on
Hamilton stands up tall to this short ball outside off and forces it to the covers for one
good length on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, ignored
good length and angling into s solid block on off
overpitched and outside off, Hamilton stretches out and belts it back straight down the ground. Flayed past the right of the bowler. His driving has been strong today
full on middle and leg, forward and tapped to mid-on for one
veering into the pads, duly glanced to fine leg
proper bouncer, Gabriel hits the deck hard and sends it thudding into the gloves of Dowrich as the batsman ducks under it
back of a length and aiming for the top of off, Hamilton's steady defensive technique intervenes
pitched up and angling away outside off, driven to the left of Roach at mid-off for a double
short and skids into off stump, defended into the covers
head-hunting lifter on leg stump, Moor does well to evade it
bouncer finishes outside leg, Moor has his eyes locked on the ball before sinking under it. His temperament has been exemplary
hip-high short ball on middle and leg, fended off to forward short leg
full and angling across off, Moor leans into a drive and places it to the off-side sweeper
short on the hips, hops and whips it away to fine leg. That single raises the hundred partnership. Well done, Moor and Hamilton
full and angling into off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length and on off, driven back to him off the front foot
shortish and outside off, the batsman drops his wrists on it
picked off the pads and placed square of fine leg
bouncer outside off, Moor ducks and evades it
full and flatter oiffbreak, turns in, chopped to cover
floated up on a fourth-stump line, defended off the front foot
back-of-a-length offbreak, punched back to Chase off the back foot
overpitched and outside off, Hamilton frees his arms and drills it through the covers with some flourish. Gave this half-volley a proper thump
tossed on middle, no turn, he now goes over the top. Chipping in front of long-on
chipped with the break to short midwicket
short of a length on middle, worked past the right of short leg for one
shorter and outside off, chopped to backward point
Gabriel bangs one into the middle of the pitch, flies through to the keeper, the batsman had ducked under it
follows the bouncer with a fuller one on middle, Moor does not move his feet much but keeps it out
full and outside off, Moor stays leg side of the ball and carves it to backward point. Hetmyer dives to his left to intercept the ball. He has been sharp there
short and hits the splice of Moor's bat as he fends it down
floated full on off, Hamilton bends forward and plays it back to Chase
this one spins more than the last ball did, inside edged back to Chase

Hamilton slog-sweeps it nay tonks it over midwicket. Tossed outside off, he goes low, and sends it clattering over the boundary. What a way to bring up 2000 Test runs. It has taken a while. Believe me, he had made his Test debut waaaaay back in 2001
dangled up on off, dead batted
defended with the break to short leg
grips, turns, catches the pad and drops in front of short leg
short and outside off, Moor rides the bounce and ramps it to the third-man boundary. Top execution, no protection at third man to cut it off
short and angled in on middle, blocked off the back foot
very full on the stumps, played back down the pitch
full-toss, dipping at leg stump, patted to midwicket
short and angling in on off, shuffles back and across and blocks to short leg
nasty bouncer outside off, Hamilton judges it well and lets it pass
dangled up outside off, Moor reaches out with his hands for a drive and inside-edges it to short fine leg
flatter, faster, breaks back in sharply to ping the thigh pad. It would have bounced over the stumps
tossed outside off, dead-bat defence
offbreak, curves in and hits the pad, this is heading down leg
Moor now goes for the sweep, but this offbreak dips, and the top edge lands to the right of short fine leg

<s>Chase provides WI with the breakthrough!</s> Hamilton has been given out caught at short leg. Hamilton confers with his partner, inspects his forearm, and chooses to challenge the on-field out decision. Hamilton had forayed down the track. Chase shortens his offbreak, this turns in to hit the front pad, no bat/glove involved. Off the front flap and into the hands of short leg. They check for lbw too, Hamilton is fine. Umpire Dharmasena eventually overturns his decision. Hamilton will bat on
floaty legbreak  finishes outside off, left alone
pushed through outside off and breaks away, no shot again
wicked dip and turn. Pitches on off and breaks past the loose prod
too full on middle, dead batted
quick fizzer outside off, left alone
tossed up on off, driven off the front foot to cover
skidding into the pads, clipped away past the right of midwicket
Chase throws this up on off, forward and smothered
worked with the turn through square leg
back of a length, starts outside off and breaks in, the batsman stands tall and punches back
full on middle and leg, presses forward and drives to short midwicket
whipped off the pads past the right of midwicket
low full-toss on off, eased to the left of long-off for a double. Hamilton moves into the nineties
tossed outside off, Hamilton pings a drive through the covers
non-turning full ball outside off, driven to cover off the front foot
tossed on off, defended to cover again
very full on middle, played back to the bowler
skids into off stump, opens the face and runs it to point
Chase held this offbreak back, Hamilton eyes up a booming drive and jams it onto the pad off an inside edge
length-ball offbreak, finishes on  off, defended back to Chase off the back foot
tossed on off, dead-bat defence
grips, turns, and bounces, Hamilton presses forward and prods at this offbreak, does not carry to short leg off the glove
short offbreak on middle, firmly pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length and breaks in, nudged to short fine leg off the back foot
pushed through on off, blocked off the front foot
tossed on off, driven down to long-off
short and spins away outside off, slapped wide of long-off for a two
tossed-up legbreak outside off, Moor goes for a slog-sweep against the break. He top-edges it hiiiiigh over Chase at midwicket
faster legbreak, pitches outside off and spins away, left alone
tossed up and breaks away outside off, edged past slip
back of a length, pushed down leg side. Keeper parries it to short fine, batsman lets it go
back of a length, spinning in rapidly at off stump. Pushed to extra cover off the back foot
poor shot. Back of a length, flies down leg side at chest height but he's looking to reverse sweep. Lucky not to edge that
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length at leg stump, can't get bat on the flick as this spins past the keeper and to short fine's right
length at off stump. Looks to reverse again. Gloves it into his body
full at middle stump, driven to extra cover
short and wide outside off, cut to cover point
short and wide, can't beat point with the cut
back of a length outside off, deep in the crease to punch this to long-off
full at middle stump, drives with the turn, down to long-off
short and wide. Spins too far away for him to execute this cut. Toe-ends it to extra cover
good length at middle stump, leans in and pokes to short mid-on
good length outside off, leans in and drives against the turn to long-off
back of a length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot

full toss outside off, leans in and squeezes it gently through the covers. Dribbles past that fielder who makes a long chase but can't pull it back. Third Test fifty for Moor and a very impressive one
back of a length at leg stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide, pushed through flat. Left alone
slider, good length at middle stump.  Inside edge onto pad as he pokes forward
full at off stump, not to the pitch as he looks to drive. Bat turns, ball ends up at extra cover
back of a length at off stump, forced to point's right off the back foot
short and wide outside off, beats point with the cut but sweeper cleans up
full outside off stump, aerially pushed off the front foot
good length at leg stump, pushes forward on the front foot and squeezes this past short leg off the inside half of the bat
good length outside off stump, defended into the covers
good length at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the inside half
back of a length at middle stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot
back of a length, leg stump, pushed to short mid-on off the back foot

bowled him. Completely misses the line, does Moor. It's been spinning sharply into his body so far, but not this one. Slightly quicker from Chase, maybe. It does turn, but not as much as before. Skids to tonk the top of off stump while he was playing the back foot defence on a middle stump line
good length at off stump, thick outside edge past the slip fielder as he defends on the front foot. Mix up between the batsmen despite what was an obvious run. Backward point wasn't close to this
full at off stump, driven straight to extra cover on the bounce
short ball just outside off, nicely on top of the bounce as he chops this through point
full outside off, big stride forward and then lets it go
good length at off stump, nicely forward and then follows it with his hands to dead-bat it

shot. Back of a length just outside off, goes deep in the crease and caresses the back foot punch through extra cover. Once again, a teasing chase for cover. We'll see a bit of that in this Test, it's a slow outfield
good length outside off, stretches forward and dabs it into the empty covers region
full at off stump, looks to drive without getting to the pitch. Inside edge through midwicket
there it is! Fifth Test century. First one since 2014. Tossed up at leg stump, stays tall like he has all day and drives confidently to long-on to bring it
back of a length at leg stump, gets the leg glance into short leg's shin
back of a length, pushed through at middle stump. Defended into the leg side
good length outside off, decides very late to step out. But adjusts hurriedly to poke it into the off side
full toss at leg stump, can't get the drive wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, defended into the off side on the front foot
short and wide outside off, chops it to sweeper
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
full at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
and what a wonderful way to start the day, full outside off and driven on the up past cover for a boundary. Big back lift, and timed well
short and wide outside off, left alone. Nice carry through to Dowrich
outside off, shoulders his arms
knocked away to midwicket for a quick run, full on off and angling onto his pads
back of a length outside off, angles into Raza. Defended off the back foot
driven back to Roach, full on off stump and fended easily
full on off, defended and the ball dribbles away to midwicket
back of a length outside off, flicked off his hips to deep midwicket. Nonchalant
full on off, forcing Raza to get bat to ball. Defended off the front foot
just short of full length outside off, left alone
short outside off, Raza bends away
short just outside off, gets inside the line of the delivery and defended off the back foot
full on off, defended and the ball dribbles away to midwicket
defends it again, back of a length just outside off. Firmly played off the back foot
full on off stump, driven back to Roach off the front foot
short otuside off, angling in but safe to be left alone
full outside off, prods forward and shoulders his arms eventually

good length outside off, but the angle is bring the ball into his stumps, big stride forward outside off stump and shoulders his arms. A well-calculated leave as the ball zips past the outside of his pads
tapped back off the back foot, good length outside off
driven with the open face towards cover, fuller delivery outside off. Not the ideal timing he would've wanted
full on middle, worked past mid on towards cow corner. Doesn't have the legs to go all the way as Chase retrieves it
a challenging bouncer, short on off and forces Raza to duck
goes short again, but goes down the leg side this time. Raza takes no chances, however: ducks at the sight of the short ball
turned off his hips to fine leg, will keep strike. Back of a length on off stump and easily negotiated

good length outside off, and stays low this time. Raza prods forward and tries to defend this but the ball zips past his bat and pad and through to Dowrich. Roach appeals! But Dowrich isn't as convinced, thinks it was thigh pad
back of a length outside off, comes slightly into Raza as he prepares to shoulder his arms. Has to navigate his arms around the quick ball while trying to get out of its way
short of a length outside off, goes straight through. Shoulders his arms again
full on off, angled into his body and driven on the up to mid on
left alone, back of a length outside off. Raza has no interest to play at it
left alone through to the keeper, good length outside off
defended off the back foot, comes inside the line of the delivery and punches it back to Gabriel
short and wide outside off, cut sweetly but it's too square. Straight to point
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
full on middle, drifts onto his pads and driven to wide long on for a four. Chase gives it a *cough cough* chase, but can't catch up
full toss going down leg side, goes one-bounce to the keeper. Masakadza might've gotten bat to it while trying to flick the loose ball away
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
back of a length outside off, flicked while jumping to get over the delivery. Goes towards the square-leg umpire
full outside off, crunched to mid off after a big stride forward
full just outside off, prods forward and defends off the front foot. Off the middle of the bat
punched off the back foot to mid off, back of a length outside off
short and wide outside off, left alone. The batsman's not tempted
defended with soft hands, back of a length on off stump and deals with it quite well
slightly slower one to start off, worked off his hips towards fine leg
full on off stump, walks inside the ball's line and defends
short outside off, Masakadza sees the ball go through to the keeper
back of a length on middle, angles down the leg side
full outside off, shoulders his arms. Stays on the lower side this time
full just outside off, prods forward and defends
turn right away, grips from outside off and turns into the stumps, worked off his hips to backward square
full outside off, tapped to short mid on
full on off, tries to defend but goes bat-pad and onto the floor
wide outside off, short too, and punched off the back foot to wide long off
worked off his hips once again past short fine leg for a single, deep midwicket has to chase and throw it back
half volley outside off and crunched on the up past cover for a boundary. Bat's face was open, and the angled blade helps it find the gap
full outside off, tapped back past the bowler to mid off
short outside off, quick to rock back and punch square to the sweeper-fielder on the off side
back of a length outside off, pokes at it, the ball dribbles away towards point
angles into the stumps, quick shuffle of the feet before defending of the back foot
short outside off, stays low as he shoulders his arms
good length outside off, adjusts well to play at it off the back foot. The ball straightened after pitching and forced the batsman to take his bat further away from his body to make the contact
back of a length outside off, turned off his hips past the square-leg umpire

full just outside off, deceives Raza with the flight and he's through his shot a big early. Charged down the wicket and takes the bat-pad before going past the non-striker, in the air, through to mid on
full on off stump, big step forward and defended off the back foot
first show of aggression today! Attempts the reverse sweep to this full ball that pitched on middle. Straight to the right-hander's short third man
gets down on one knee and muscles this from off stump to deep midwicket
defended off the front foot, falls just in front of short leg
short outside off, punched off the back foot to Holder
back of a length outside off, angled into him, bunted to midwicket off the back foot
short outside off, angles slightly away from Masakadza, lets it go through
pitched up fuller outside off this time, lets it go once again. He's not playing at anything that's coming onto his body or pitched up
inside edge! Just misses the stumps. Short just outside off and tries to punch towards cover, big gap between bat and pad, and takes the inside of the bat
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
full toss on middle, cross-batted slog past midwicket. The fielder at deep backward square has to chance. Also the team 200
back of a length outside off, flicks this while tiptoeing. One-bounce to short leg
good length on off stump, turned to short fine leg
tossed up outside off this time and Raza crunches this. Driven on the up, goes past the diving cover-fielder, and Roach has to give it a chase
full outside off, sharp turn in, defended with soft hands. He's beware of the short-leg fielder
tossed up full outside off, big stride forward and defended
short outside off, the classic big back lift comes out once again, punched square past point to the deep
short outside off, flicked off his waist to midwicket for a quick run. Brings up the fifty partnership for the duo.
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, goes straight through after pitching, punched off the back foot to mid on
fullish outside off, left alone
full outside off, big stride forward but chooses not to play it. Shoulders his arms
good length on leg stump, turns away from him and goes down the leg side

completely misses the reverse sweep! full on middle and sharp off spin after pitching. Raza tries to paddle that behind the right-hander's short third man, but can't get the necessary contact. Dowrich can't hold onto it either
driven full to mid off, fuller delivery
he's lost his line after going around the wicket, back of a length outside leg stump, spins further away down the leg side
appeal from Dowrich for caught behind but his team-mates aren't interested. Full on leg stump and the offspin takes it down the leg side, but it went just past his bat

oh my, full on leg stump and Hammy goes down on one knee to slap this over point. Except he's playing the reverse sweep. Can't get the best connection, but slices it instead, goes over the infield and through for a boundary
full outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, angles onto his pads and it's flicked to midwicket for a quick run
hammered! Full outside off and enough width to time his square drive to perfection. Races away

more runs! Pitches it up once again, and drives it straight this time. Past Holder's left, and mid off dives to his right, getting his fingers onto it. Reduces the ball's pace, but it has enough leg on it to go for four
lets it go this time, full outside off

short on off stump and pulled so well by Masakadza. It's in the slot to be hit, but he has timed it so well. Gets into position early, well swivelled, and the full extension of his hands to play that shot. Ain't nobody stoppin' that
full on middle, driven back to Chase
full on middle, sharp offspin and stays low as well, worked off his pads towards short leg

in the air, but short leg's dive is a valiant one. Short on off and tries to work this to fine leg, takes the bottom edge and then the front pad, and lobs between the keeper and short leg. Falls juuust short
full outside off, driven through cover, quality shot
short outside off, spins inwards, punched off the back foot
excessive offspin, good length on middle and the turn takes it down the leg side
short and wide from Bishoo to start, Masakadza rocks back and nails a cut to the sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover again
shortish outside off, too short is Bishoo, punched away towards cover. A misfield allows one
short and wide again, hit to the short cover fielder. Holder fields, ouch, that would have hurt
74 kph, short outside off, spins away, tapped to point. No run. Too short
good length around off, nice lines but noting troubling which is why I think they'll take the new ball. Defended to cover
short and wide, too much width from Holder. Masakadza arches his back, transfers his weight onto his back foot and slashes a cut in front of gully. The deep point fielder has no chance, well placed
a touch short and Masakadza picks the length early, goes back and smashes a pull to deep square leg
pad? Bat? 125 kph, down leg, Raza misses his flick, but it doesn't miss the pad. Clips the outside of his pad and just misses a diving Dowrich to his left. Four leg byes
full around off, 132 kph, defended to mid-off
short down leg, 123 kph, Raza gets underneath that
shortish outside off, spins away, left alone
79 kph, short and wide outside off, another leave
tooooo short from Bishoo, slashed to the sweeper cover for one
still too short, Raza stays back and cuts to the sweeper cover. Zimbabwe will be so pleased with this tripe
aargh, another short and wide delivery, hammered to Holder at cover, who gets a hand on it
that's his best delivery, bowls this fuller around off, Masakadza nicely plays the line before shoving the bat behind the pad. The ball spins away
a gentle full toss on off, pushed back to the bowler
the sweep, premeditated. It was very full, a low full toss in fact, swept to deep backward square leg
another sweep, but Masakadza got well outside the line. Misses, struck on the pad. An easy decision for the umpire
shortish on middle and leg, the ball spinning in, worked to midwicket
slow through the air, around middle and leg, played into the leg side
chips down the track, gets there and drives to long-on for one. Nicely played
some turn. Quick down leg, the ball rips away, takes the outside edge and trickles down towards third man for a couple

Bishoo strikes! Masakadza's marathon innings ends with a top-edged sweep. Lots of flight outside off from Bishoo, Masakadza may have premeditated the sweep if he saw anything full. It was actually there for the big slog sweep, but like Williamson yesterday, the ball just spins away and takes the top edge. Dowrich runs towards short leg and takes a simple catch. A legspinner always puts more revolutions on the ball, which makes sweeping a dangerous option.
short and wide outside off, 81 kph, left alone
short and wide from Bishoo, thrashed past Holder at short cover. Long-off cleans up
full outside off, plenty of flight, defended towards point
overpitched on leg, driven towards mid-on

right through Waller. A golden duck. Superb bowling from Brathwaite, slow and wide outside off, lots of flight. The ball was pitched in an area that almost always invites the drive. And Waller bites, goes through with a loose drive, which creates a big gap between bat and pad. The ball finds that gap and knocks into middle and leg stump. A poor option first up
the sweep, flight outside off, paddled down to fine leg
short and quick, pushed through on off, defended
that's the shot Waller tried, driving against the spin, but Raza has been there awhile, gets close enough to the pitch to drive to mid-off
and again. Very slow outside off, inviting the drive, big gap between bat and pad, and Chakabva gets a thick edge to midwicket
flight on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
loads of flight outside off, defended into the off side by Raza
another sweep. Slow around off, Raza misses his slog sweep, the wicketkeeper takes off the stump and appeals for a stumping, but Raza's back foot is fine
shortish outside off, spinning away, left alone
flight outside off, driven to long-off for one. A good option, driving with the spin
short and wide outside off, carved towards cover
nicely bowled, slow outside off, the ball spins away, left alone
short down leg, 86 kph, an ODI wide. Dowrich gets down to stop some runs with his pad. May have been some glove, will go down as a drop
short on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
flight outside off, 76 kph, the ball spins back in, inside-edged into the pad
some bat, short around off and middle, the ball spins back in, takes the inside edge into the pad
shortish outside off, Chakabva goes back and drives towards cover. Brathwaite goes running after it, but can't prevent two
lots of flight outside off, driven to long-on for one
lots of flight outside off, solidly defended into the off side
tossed up around middle, blocked
short and wide outside off, Chakabva stays back and lets it go
ooh, a thick edge, wide of gully. Shortish and wide outside off, a waft at that, thick outside edge evades gully for a couple
flight outside off, 84 kph, defended
another cross-batted shot, flight outside off, a sweep but no connection
low full toss outside off, driven to long-on
short on middle and leg, worked towards short leg
flight outside off, 83 kph, solidly blocked
flight outside off, inside-edged into the boot
lots of flight on leg, easily smothered away
flight on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket
short outside off, 83 kph, defended towards point
short and wide outside off, left alone, 81 kph
short and wide again, left alone
78 kph, lots of flight outside off, no stroke
too wide outside off, Raza not interested in playing just yet
shortish outside off, worked to deep midwicket for a couple
85 kph, quick on middle and leg, worked to midwicket with the spin
short and wide, spinning in, Chakabva pushes the ball back awkwardly
short and wide again, too slow, Chakabva rocks back and cuts into the gap at point for some runs
short down leg, off the pad into the leg side
shortish down leg, worked down to short fine leg
another shortish delivery, Raza hurries back and outside-edges towards third man for one
82 kph, flight on off, worked to mid-on for one
short and wide outside off, 74 kph, pulled into the leg side, towards midwicket
beaaauty! Slow around off, the ball spins away and beats the bat. Lovely pace and loop
lots of flight outside off, driven back to the bowler
some flight around middle, swept away to deep square leg for one. Keeps it along the ground

another one. Chakabva has stuck with the sweep, and he does not make contact again. Has struggled for any fluency right through the innings. It's quick and full on leg, Chakabva premeditated the sweep, got low but does not make contact. The ball finds a big gap between both his legs and hits the stumps. Poor shot selection
short and straight, the ball spins in, inside-edged to short leg
shortish around middle and leg, pushed towards midwicket
full outside off, driven to long-off for one
short outside off, the ball spinning back in, worked into the leg side
big appeal. Was there bat? Quick outside off, the ball spinning in, may have been an inside edge into the pad

slow outside off, Cremer gets a massive inside edge into his pad. Brathwaite appeals. Holder has reviewed. Was it bat first or pad first? Looks like it was pad first. Umpire's call on impact, but the ball is spinning down leg. So that's a review lost
more flight down leg, Raza gets forward to smother the spin
on the pads, 81 kph, worked into the leg side, to midwicket
picks the length early does Raza, hurries back and swats away a pull over midwicket to get to fifty. The legspinner will drop short and you have to put that away, good patience from Raza
flight outside off, driven to cover
short and wide outside off, another leave
flight outside off, 73 kph, slapped down to long-off for a run
81 kph, flight on middle and off, defended back
lots of flight around off, smothered back
short down leg, 75 kph, defended
pushed through in the air, quick on leg, played into the leg side
oooh, comes down, looking to drive against the spin but the ball has enough room to spin, takes the inside edge and misses short leg.
shortish on middle and leg, 77 kph, worked to midwicket
74 kph short and wide outside off, left alone
flight on middle and leg, kept out
lots of flight, 85 kph, on the pads, hit into the pad
a low full toss around off, Raza stays low and swats a sweep into the gap at deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, 84 kph, carved to the sweeper cover for one. A tad too short
flight outside off, 77 kph, the ball spins away. Cremer lets it go
79 kph, quick down leg, worked to short leg.
slow on the pads, played into the leg side
shortish outside off, the ball spinning in, Raza goes right back to cut towards cover
flight outside off, 87 kph, driven towards wide mid-off for a run again
84 kph, quick down leg, played into the leg side
smothered back again.
lots of flight outside off, driven to the sweeper cover for a run. Playing with the spin
quick on off, 83 kph, defended back
short around off, 78 kph, the ball pitches on leg, spins to off, defended to cover
the flipper, quick outside off, blocked
short and wide this time, Cremer sees width and carves a cut towards point, pulled back just inside the boundary
beautiful end. Slow and wide outside off, lulls Raza into a drive, the ball spins away and beats the bat
87 kph, quick down leg, off the pad into short leg.
short on the pad, 87 kph, worked towards square leg for one
a low full toss on middle, pushed to long-on for one
short on middle, the ball spinning back in, worked to midwicket
pushed through, quick outside off, smothered back
short outside off, 74 kph, the ball spins back in, defended
flight outside off, 83 kph, driven to mid-off for one. With the spin again
shortish outside off, nice and slow, the ball spins away, bounces wide of first slip, goes through for one
slow and wide outside off, 74 kph, defended into the point region
flight around off, defended back
short and wide outside off, Raza goes back and slashes a cut to the sweeper cover
flight on middle and off, 80 kph, defended back
steps out, gets to the pitch to drive to long-on
88 kph, short on middle and leg, worked into the leg side region
short down leg, played to leg gully
overpitched outside off, 86 kph, pushed towards mid-off for one
flight outside off, 76 kph, worked to midwicket
driven wide of long-off for a run. 88 kph. And that will be lunch on day 2
on target first up, back of a length just outside off, forces Raza to defend off the back foot. He wants a single, but is quickly sent back
full on off stump, walks across and flicks this off his pads to fine leg
full just outside off, driven to cover with the angled bat
pitched full on off, pushed down the ground past the non-striker, but mid on is there to cut it off
tries the short one this time, pitches outside off and forces Cremer to get under the ball. Does well to eventually get away
short outside off, tails in after the ball goes past the batsman. Left alone by Cremer
back of a length outside off, shoulders his arms. Stays slightly low as the ball goes through to Dowrich
crunched between point and cover for a boundary, half volley outside off and pounces on it in a flash. Full flow of the bat. Delightful
lets this one go through to the keeper, short and wide outside off
rocks back and defends off the back foot, good length on off stump. Did well to cover to ball's line
slightly shorter this time, Raza is up to the challenge. Defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, no danger from that delivery as Raza lets it go through
full outside off and caressed towards cover, Holder dives to his left and stops the ball from going through. Gets his fingertips to it and reduces the pace
a dangerous leave that almost came back to haunt Cremer. It was good length outside off and comes back sharply into his body. Tails in after pitching and goes inches over middle and off. Lucky
back of a length wider outside off, shoulders his arms. The ball tails in after pitching once again
back of a length just outside off, goes straight through to the keeper. Cremer not interested to engage with these deliveries
movement in the air this time after pitching, back of a length just outside off, Cremer lets it go as the ball flies over top of middle stump
fuller one to end the over, it's pitched outside off and Cremer gets his pad forward to cover the line and lets the ball go
full outside off, shuffles and lets it go through. Close to off stump but Raza ensured the line was covered
back of a length just outside off, shuffles and defends off the back foot
full on off and drifts onto his pads, worked in front of square between midwicket and mid on, and it just reaches the ropes before Chase can get there
short outside off, not the bounce he expected as it stays low, tries to pull but the bat goes over the ball
attempts to tuck this off his hips but hits his pads instead, good length on middle and can't whip it away
full outside off, driven on the up. Straight to cover
full outside off, tries to defend but plays down the wrong line. Takes the outside edge and flies away to wide-ish third man
edged again and this time it's taken! Full outside off and Raza prods forward to defend at it, but takes the outside edge. Pocketed easily by second slip. Raza's innings comes to a close

full outside off and he gets a boundary off his first ball in Test cricket! It's not a convincing shot, but runs all the same. It's a yorker just outside off stump, tries to get his bat down and takes the inside edge of the bat, past the diving Dowrich and behind for four
full on middle and off, respectfully defended
wide outside off, shoulders his arms
back of a length outside off stump, angles away from the left hander, tapped towards cover with soft hands
back of a length outside off, tucked away towards backward square off his hips
full on off stump, comes inside the line and driven back to Roach. Full face of the bat
good length attacking the stumps, forces Cremer to defend off the back foot
ooo, almost a run out. Back of a length on off and pushed towards midwicket for a single, realises it's a bad option and turns back, the fielder races in and has a shy at the stumps, but misses
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot towards cover
full on off stump, punched down the ground but not the perfect timing by any means. Dribbles away to mid on, and Cremer will lose strike
full on off stump, mistimed drive to short midwicket
fullish on middle, well defended with soft hands. Displaying technique in that shot
tucks it short this time, a shame it's going down the leg side. Doesn't challenge the lower-order batsman at all
full on middle, defended off the back foot. Quick to go back into the crease
full outside off, left alone
almost a yorker on off stump, dug away towards midwicket
full on middle, whipped away off his hips to midwicket for a quick run
risky single, and lucky to survive Cremer. Tapped to point off the back foot and takes off. Slight hesitation before competing the run
full outside off, defended off the back foot
good length outside off stump but nips in after pitching. Shoulders his arms, but the ball goes just past his off stump once again. Cremer living dangerously
misses the cut completely, wide outside off but not enough width to get to that, cuts over the ball
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to work this towards midwicket. Can't take the single that would've given him strike
driven uppishly past extra cover for a run, full outside off and entices him to drive. Falls for the trap, but falls between extra cover and wide id off

full outside off, crunched to mid off and it's a direct hit at the non-striker's! Time for the third umpire. Cremer took off for the run, but he was running straight towards Gabriel, and had to deviate from his path and ran diagonally to get to the other end. Holder's direct hit is good, Cremer is short by a few inches. He's got to go
full on off stump, slogged past midwicket, muscled away really and midwicket's dive can't stop the ball
pulled straight to fine leg. Short on leg stump and confidently hit to the fielder in the deep
full outside off, prods forward looking to defend, goes past the outside edge and the keeper plus slips are interested for a caught-behind. Umpire says no, and neither did the bowler look convinced
steered between the cordon and gully for a boundary! Just gets his bat to meet the fullish delivery outside off stump and takes a nice outside edge off the blade and flies past the gap. Useful runs

slower ball on middle stump, deceives the batsman and hits him on the pad in front of middle. Loud appeal and out says the umpire. Chisoro quick to review. It was full-pitched, goes under the bat and hits him in front of leg stump. Would've gone on to break leg stump. Zimbabwe are all out for 326.
full and wide outside off, very wide, left alone easily enough
good length around off, 132 kph, sliny action, defended back. Hardly any swing so far
drifts down leg this time, 132 kph, no contact with anything but the tips of the keeper's fingers. Byes to fine leg
well bowled, full and straight, 130 kph, make Brathwaite play. Defended to mid-on
full around off, 137 kph, Brathwaite closes the bat face and works the ball into the leg side
lovely bowling, full around off, 138 kph, just a bit of shape, inswing. Worked down to fine leg
full and straight, on leg, 131 kph. Not much swing, worked into the leg side
lovely bowling. Keeping it full to see if swing is available. Not yet. Around off, pushed away to mid-on
a bit leg side-ish, 129 kph, clipped to square leg
overpitched outside off, no swing, an easy languid drive to mid-off. Just need to pull that length a few inches
full and wide outside off, nice length, but too far to draw a stroke. Left alone
good length down leg, a simple nudge down to fine leg to retain strike, again. Brathwaite faced 12 off 12 so far
that's a poor delivery. Short and wide outside off, sits up for Brathwaite to get on top of the bounce and hit the ball down, past backward point
shortish delivery outside off, defended towards cover
full and straight, 137 kph, around middle and leg, nudged towards midwicket
a tad too full outside off, Brathwaite strides forward and drives towards mid-off, to his right
on a length, around off, pushed away towards mid-on
shortish and wide outside off, left alone
overpitched outside off, 130 kph, too wide, left alone
brings that full length closer to off, but it's still too full. Driven back to the bowler
full around off, 130 kph, defended back
that's too straight, around leg, nudged down to fine leg for one. A good line to the right-hander
shortish outside off, not much pace, spongy bounce, defended back
129 kph, full delivery outside off, skewed away towards point for none
shortish delivery outside off, 135 kph, some swing back in, defended into the off side
139 kph, short outside off, left alone
good length on a fifth-stump channel, some extra bounce. Powell plays the line and allows himself to be beaten by a long distance
short and wide outside off, left alone
full delivery outside off, 135 kph, keeps its line. Powell skews a drive towards point
full outside off, fifth, maybe sixth-stump line. A thick outside edge goes down, in the gap at gully for four. Troubling line from Mpofu, Powell playing with nice, soft hands
full around off, 130 kph, blocked back
shortish outside off, sits up again for Brathwaite to defend into the off side
again, too short. Sits up for Brathwaite on a slow surface, easy enough to defend into the off side
goes fuller, outside off, Brathwaite gets forward to keep it out
ooh, some swing. 131 kph, around off, the ball swings away late. Brathwaite closes his bat face too early, and gets a thick edge towards gully
133 kph, overpitched around off, driven to mid-on
good length around off from around the wicket, a solid defensive block back
on the pads, 134 kph, nudged away to square leg. Not much happening here
well bowled, fires a wide carrot for Powell, but he doesn't bite. Left alone nicely
good length outside off, no stroke from Powell, 130 kph
full and wide again, 133 kph, left alone
full delivery outside off, 129 kph, another leave. Two successive maidens
good length outside off, 127 kph, hardly anything to trouble Brathwaite's defensive technique
slightly overpitched, around off, driven to mid-on
134 kph, full on off, nothing getting past that defense for now
135 kph, overpitched and wide outside off. Right in the slot for the drive, but no stroke offered
and again. Full and very wide outside off, another leave. Mire trying to bore Brathwaite, too early for that
better line, just outside off, 136 kph, defended back
good length around off, 132 kph, defended into the off side, towards point
full and wide outside off, another easy leave
good length around off, 134 kph, worked into the leg side. Straying a touch too straight
overpitched outside off, another half-volley that has been left alone. West Indies too cautious against relatively middling bowling
the offcutter, good change-up, pitched around off, the ball moves away, leaving Powell's bat hanging
full and wide outside off, left alone
flight around off, defended back, nice loop to start
on the pads this time, Brathwaite flicks to deep square leg for a run
shortish outside off, the ball turning back in, Powell goes right back to defend
more flight outside off, Powell strides forward to push to mid-off
a thick edge, this one doesn't turn as much as Powell expected. Natural variation. A thick edge dies to slip's right. Some runs
shortish delivery outside off, swatted to mid-on for one
full on off stump, whips it behind square on the leg side. Uses his wrists
back of a length just outside off, straightens after pitching, tapped away towards point
short and wide outside off, left alone by Powell
stays low after pitching outside off this time, hurries him to defend off the back foot
angles into the left hander from around the wicket, defended off the front foot
full outside off, driven on the up. Straight to cover
spins away from the batsman after pitching on middle, poked away towards point
drift in the air, lands on middle, big stride forward
good length on middle stump, goes deep and defends off the back foot
fuller outside off this time, well negotiated by Brathwaite. Defended with a big step forward
short on off stump, turns further away giving him the width to cut. Not timed well enough, but will still get him a couple
tossed up wide outside off, pushed to mid off and takes a quick single
sharp offspin first up, back of a outside off and nips back in. Fools the batsman, and it strikes him outside his off stump
fuller outside off, worked towards short leg
stays low this time, back of a length outside off and does well to keep the ball away from his pads
full outside off, driven towards the leg side. Straight to midwicket
tossed up full outside off, defended with soft hands, ensures the ball stays along the ground
wide outside off, unconvincingly driven to cover
full on leg stump, dances down and punched to long on
drift in the air, good length on off stump, backs away and cuts to point
full on off stump, prods forward and defends
full outside off, comes in front and plays it on the up towards cover. Mistimed, the ball stays nearby
full on middle and off, comes forward and defends, negating the spin on offer
back of a length outside off, punched to long on
back of a length outside off stump, worked off his hips towards the leg side
good length on middle, tries to whip this behind square. But straight to backward square
full on off stump, defended back to Raza
outside off this time, driven but no timing. Straight to cover
full outside off, takes the outside edge after defending. First slip has to give it a chase
full on middle, tapped away towards the leg side. Big step forward
full on off stump, driven down the ground to mid off
spins into the left hander after pitching outside off, goes deep into the crease and defended
flighted on middle, uses the depth of the crease to defend
full outside off, defended off the front foot
back of a length just on off stump, worked off his hips towards fine leg
straighter one to end the session. Full on off stump, and goes straight through. Gets behind the line of the ball to defend. And that's tea.
back of a length outside off, left alone as the ball spins away from the left hander
drifts onto leg stump, tapped away to deep midwicket for an easy run
full on middle and off, worked off his pads behind square. Straight to short fine leg
lops to short leg. Full on middle and he misses the whip, hits him on the back pad and pops up
full face of the bat offered, full outside off stump
flies past short leg's right. Full on middle stump and the ball zips past away after taking the inside edge off the defense

bump ball straight to Cremer, but he can't hold on to it anyway. Replays suggest it came flush off the bat though. Will go down as a dropped catch. Back of a length outside leg stump and he charges to hit it straight. A chance goes begging
full on off stump, worked towards the leg side

dropped! Another one goes down, charges down and smashes it down the ground, Cremer does well to get out of the way but gets his hands to it anyway. Sometimes these balls stick to your hand, this time it didn't
punished! Short outside off and pounces on it rapidly. Pulled past midwicket for four
back of a length outside off, left alone
short outside off, cut straight to point. Two legitimate chances going down this over
back of a length outside off, goes straight through. Decides not to cut
defended off the back foot from outside off stump, good length delivery
full outside off, big back lift, but no shot offered. Through to Dowrich
slower one this time, back of a length just outside off, leaves it
wide outside off, in the slot to be cut anywhere on the off side, but played straight to point
back of a length outside off, waits for the ball before opening the bat's face to glance the ball towards third man. Goes straight to the fielder positioned inside the circle, though
drifts onto middle and leg, it's full and defended carefully
lots of revolutions in that one, good length just outside off, sees the ball through to the keeper
tossed up just outside off, tries to entice with the flight, but Brathwaite is careful to commit. Defended
tossed up on off stump again, pushed back to Cremer
full outside off, drives to mid off and wants the single. But Powell refuses
full on middle, legspin, goes deep and defends with soft hands
good length on middle, goes deep into the crease and punches it back to Raza
in the air, but just short of Raza. Flighted on off and through his shot too early, pops up but falls just short of the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, pinged away off the inside edge towards square leg
full on middle, defended towards mid on off the front foot
slower one this time, drifts and lands on leg stump, pushed in front of square on the leg stump. They walk through for the run.
drops his length slightly to the right hander, pitches on middle, worked off his pads to square leg
sees Powell coming and digs in a googly around off, well improvised punch to cover
flight around middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
loads of flight around off, a languid drive is too well timed to mid-off, no run
uses his feet, gets there and drives against the spin towards wide mid-off for one. Well played
a high full toss around middle, shovelled to deep midwicket for one. Easily played
the googly, on off, 77 kph, defended back confidently
85 kph, overpitched around off, pushed back to the bowler
pushed through, flat trajectory, defended towards short leg
well bowled, shortens the length outside off, spinning in, nudged to short fine leg
quick outside off, some turn back in, defended
short down leg, clipped to short fine leg, a tad too leg side-ish
overpitched outside off, 83 kph, played to midwicket with the spin. Tidy over
overpitched, 82 kph, flight outside off, but too much of it. Because it's so full, Powell can drive against the spin without much risk. Nailed through extra cover
quick and straight, around off, defended back
quick around off, inside-edged towards short fine leg
the googly, back of the hand, nice and straight but Powell read it well, went back and defended
shortish and quick and straight, defended back
this one is too short and too wide, slashed through cover for a couple more. Pulled just inside by Moor
overpitched and wide outside off, driven to cover
77 kph, this is short down leg, easy clip to short fine leg
hurried through in the air, pushing Brathwaite on the back foot, shovelled to midwicket
slow through the air this time outside off, Brathwaite gets forward to smother the spin
nicely played. Too much flight on that, outside off, carved away in the gap between mid-off and cover for three. Good chase and pull-back by Chisoro, who saves one
beauty! 79 kph, slow through the air on middle and leg, pitches and rips past the outside edge. The doubt-creator
another googly outside off, some spin back in, Brathwaite stays back, reads it off the pitch and defends
the legbreak spinning away but Brathwaite gets forward to block
short and wide outside off, spinning away but Brathwaite reads the length, rocks back and swats a pull in the gap at midwicket for two. Pulled in just inside again
lovely delivery, quick through the air on off, defended
overpitched on off, driven to mid-on. Strong bottom hand
good end, lots of loop around off, gets Brathwaite forward, played away
quick outside off, 87 kph, pushed through in the air, left alone
and spins past the outside edge again. Or did it take some bat? No, no bat. Slow on off, spins away
nice loop around off, kept out again
quick and straight, the one that doesn't turn, slides on. Powell is on the back foot to defend
another one that is quick and straight, around off, pushed into the off side
84 kph, tossed up around off, defended back
too short again outside off, the occasional filthy long-hop from the legspinner, whacked away to deep midwicket for two
slow around middle, driven to mid-on
a low full toss, quick through the air, worked away towards square leg for one
short around off, spinning in, 80 kph, nudged with the spin towards square leg
nicely played. Use of the feet, gets close, converts flight into a full toss and drives to cover's left. A fumble allows one
a googly on leg, clipped to square leg
slow in the air, around leg, worked away towards wide mid-on for one. 50-run stand between WI's openers
slow around off, 82 kph, clipped to short leg
quick on off, 83 kph, defended
short on the pads, 82 kph, nudged to backward square leg. Really running through these overs are the spinners.
tossed up on off, smothered back
short on the pads, nudged to short leg
nice start, shortish around off, spinning in, defended from the back foot
just short of long-on. Flight outside off, drilled towards Mire at long-on, who runs in, looking for the catch all along. But the ball lands in front
88 kph, on the pads, worked away to square leg
87 kph, some flight on middle and leg, nudged away to midwicket
quick outside off, 86 kph, defended back
short around off, 87 kph, pushed through, shovelled into the leg side, with the spin
slow on the pads, 81 kph, Brathwaite comes forward and smothers the spin
quick around off, 84 kph, Brathwaite goes back and outside-halves a defensive stroke towards third man for one
quick on off, because it's so flat Powell goes back and defends
shortish outside off, spinning away, dabbed to point, 79 kph
flight on middle, worked against the spin to a deep mid-on for one
slow around off and middle, easily defended
very wide outside off, padded away to safety. Turned into the left hander
full toss outside off, crisply driven to cover
full outside off, punched down the ground, Chisoro dives to his left and stops the single
back of a length outside off, spins into the left-hander's pads, defended away
fuller outside off stump, tapped back to Chisoro
short outside off, spins into his pads, worked off his hips to square leg
tucked off his pads to short fine leg, short on leg stump
full on middle stump, worked off his toes, one-bounce to short leg
back of a length on middle, quickly tucked away
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to the region near square leg
full on off stump, driven down the ground to Raza
full just outside off, tries to work this towards midwicket but the bat turns, goes further square behind
firmly defended back to Chisoro. Full on off stump
full on his toes just outside off stump, uses his wrists to whip this towards cow corner. There's a fielder positioned there
tossed up wide outside off, draws Brathwaite forward to defend, goes past his outside edge. Sharp take by Dowrich too
tossed up full on off stump, defended carefully with soft hands ensuring the ball stays low
drifts and lands on middle stump, big stride forward and defended
full and wide outside off, spins further away from his attempted front-foot defense
full on off stump, comfortably pushed back to mid off
flighted, lands full on middle, defended off the front foot. Firmly
full on off stump, prods forward and gets his bat down really late, he waited a long bit to check the spin out
wide outside off, spins further away, cut off the toe end of the bat, to point
drifts and lands on leg stump, turns towards the off side, defended, takes the outside edge
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
full outside off and charges down the wicket, lifted over wide mid off's head and runs away to the long-on boundary
full on middle, worked off his toes to deep midwicket
full on middle once again, comes forward and carefully defends from top of off stump
slightly shorter outside off this time, pushed off the front foot to mid off
wide outside off, spins further away, cut to point
back of a length  just outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle, angles down the leg side, raps him on the pad as the ball is going down
back of a length angling onto his body once again,  tapped to the empty region square on the leg side. They scamper through for the run
fuller outside off for the right hander, punched down the ground to the diving mid-on fielder
slightly lesser pace this time, full on middle, worked off his toes to backward square
full on off stump, tails into his pads, clipped to midwicket
full just outside off, tries to drive straight but the bat turns in his hand. Pinged away to midwicket
skids through after pitching on middle stump, does well to get his bat in front of his pads, inside edge towards the leg side
full on middle, driven back to Chisoro
tossed up full on middle, clipped off his toes to deep backward square
good length on middle, tucked off his hips fine on the leg side, dribbles away and leg slip gives it a chase
full on middle, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, poked away to short third man
full outside off, drilled to cover. Full face of the bat and well negated
comes inside the line of the ball, and punches it back to Mpofu. These two are set now.
back of a length outside off, angles into his body, tapped away to wide long on
full outside off, left alone as the ball goes straight through to Dowrich
full outside off, big stride forward before shouldering his arms, covered the off-stump line though
full and wide outside off, lets the ball go through
beauty! slides past his outside edge, gives it some air, and the ball grips on off stump and turns away, zips past his outside edge
back of a length just outside off, backs away and cut. But straight to point
back of a length outside off, can't make the connection again. Goes towards point
tossed up on off stump, almost a yorker and dug away towards short midwicket

flatter one, faster too. Straightens after pitching and Brathwaite's back-foot defense was played down the wrong line. Just past his outside edge, and also missing off stump but the smallest of margins
back of a length on off stump, tapped towards midwicket
wide outside off, shoulders his arms. Carries through well to Chakabva
angled into the left-hander this time, good length on off stump, covers the off-stump line and defends off the back foot
full on off stump, driven straight to cover. Packed infield on the off side
full on off, pinged back to Mpofu
full outside off, big stride forward and shoulders his arms after that
good length outside off once again, pushed off the back foot to mid off
lots of flight around off, 80 kph, defended back to the bowler
some spin. Flight around off, the ball spins away and beats the bat. Nice loop, getting some turn
shortish and wide, too wide to draw a stroke, but that one spun too
