lots of flight around off, worked away to mid-on, full enough to play against the spin
excellent delivery, slow on off, asking Brathwaite to play but he knows the ball will turn sop he lets it go
nudged to midwicket against the spin. Four maidens on the bounce. I know this is Test cricket, but WI over-cautious
smashed that. 134 kph, full and wide outside off, hammered past cover, who may have got a hand on it to prevent the boundary. A fielder chases it down, pulled back just inside
good length outside off, 135 kph, left alone
full around off, seaming back in, nudged to the finer of those two short midwickets
a slower, wide delivery and Brathwaite sees an opportunity to drive through extra cover for three. Again, pulled back just inside.
short around off, ab bouncer, Powell ducks underneath and then shadow-practices a forehand swat through midwicket
another loopy bouncer that goes over Powell's head, 137 kph, but the slowness of the surface makes it carry at ankle height
shortish delivery outside off, 87 kph, no stroke
slightly leg side-ish, nudged down to short fine leg
pops out into the off side off the shoulder of the bat. Nicely bowled, quick through the air. Brathwaite lunges forward, but doesn't get close to the pitch
shortish outside off, defended into the off side off the back foot
flight outside off, Brathwaite gets forward and smothers the ball
short down leg, 87 kph, nudged down to short fine leg. Surprise, another maiden
short around off, just medium pace late in the day, 115 kph, worked away to deep square leg for an easy single
full and straight, 130 kph, late swing back in, worked to square leg
a full, straight delivery. Flicked to one of two midwickets. Good strategy this, get Brathwaite to play everything. Some late swing opens up lbw
fullish length, coming back in at 131 kph, defended to mid-on easily enough
short and wide this time, plenty of width, left alone
good finish, 129 kph, full around off, worked into the leg side, definite late movement for Mpofu
flicked away for a boundary. Woohoo. Short down leg from Chisoro, poor ball, Powell whips the ball through the line, enough power to take the ball to the backward square leg boundary. Well played too
well bowled, flat outside off, dabbed into the gap at cover for a tight, but right run
short and wide outside off, scythed towards short third man

overpitched on middle and leg, flicked to short leg, who picks up cleanly and returns a throw to the keeper, who then takes off the bails with the batsman back. The umpires confer whether the ball has carried. That surely bounced at least once. The soft signal is not out. Clearly bounced, but replays also show an explosion of the pitch, so Zimbabwe will be happy with that at least
overpitched on off, flicked away through midwicket for a run
short and quick on the pads, ricochets off the thigh pad into the leg side
flight on middle and leg from Cremer, Brathwaite gets forward to smother the spin
flight on middle and leg, 80 kph, worked into the leg side
slow around middle and leg, smothered away
overpitched on off, 83 kph. You rather be too full than too short, another block

and Cremer strikes! Where in this world did that come from? Short delivery on off, Brathwaite plays back, forced back rather because of the flatter trajectory. Cremer pushes that full despite that flat trajectory, allowing the ball enough room to turn. It does, it takes the outside edge and carries low to slip, who takes a sharp catch. That's a sensational ball, did him in in the air, with the flight, or lack of it
shortish and wide outside off, spin back in, defended
short and wide outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover
flight around off, Bishoo gets forward to smother the spin
short and wide, 77 kph, slapped into Ervine's shin at silly point
slow around off, shortish. Bishoo goes back to defend
lots of flight around off, 79 kph, Bishoo comes right forward to defend that
82 kph, more flight outside off, hit into the body of silly point
Zimbabwe happy with that, overpitched outside off, driven to long-off for one
lots of flight on leg, 75 kph, smothered away
pushed through, quick but full. Bishoo gets forward and defends
overpitched again, 76 kph, nicely defended back to the bowler
the googly outside off, 76 kph, Bishoo had no idea of that, played for the legbreak and was beaten by a mile.

flight outside off, Bishoo goes driving and is beaten on the outside edge. Chakabva takes off the bails, and the leg umpire calls for the third umpire. But Bishoo is safe. So that will be stumps on day 2
pretty full and skidding into the pads, forward and clipped away to short midwicket
another non-turner that ends on leg stump, clipped away again, this time to the left of midwicket
tossed on off, dead-bat defence
speared very full and outside off, scoots under the bat, kisses the keeper's pad and disturbs the stumps
pushed through on off, defended stoutly
tossed up and breaking down leg - turn of the slow variety, tickled fine past the keeper. Off the glove and rolls away
shorter and plenty of width outside off, Powell leans back and crisply punches it through cover point. There's no stopping that
slower, fuller legbreak, finishes on off, smothered off the front foot
back of a length and breaks back in, defended to midwicket off the back foot
lobbed up on off stump, played back off the front foot
short and turns in, punched off the back foot wide of midwicket
overpitched and outside off, Bishoo does not need any second invitations for a drive. He leans into it and caresses it through extra cover. Nice, confident stride
dangled up just a shade outside off, driven back off the front foot
short and width outside off, he skips back and cracks it to backward point
short and skids into the thigh, whipped away to deep midwicket off the back foot. Powell brings up a solid, solid fifty. Barely any celebrations from the opener
on a length and skids through outside off, patted to cover
tossed outside off, swept away confidently to deep midwicket
back of a length and spins back into a tight defence
tossed outside off, a whippy drive to long-on ensues
starts outside off and breaks in on middle, he covers up in defence
short and spins in on off, patted down onto the pitch off the back foot
full and outside off, presses forward and drives through the line to cover
short legbreak, finishes on the leg stump, he skips back and swats it away to deep midwicket. Cremer needs to get his lengths right
too short and outside off again, the batsman happily steers it through point off the back foot
tossed on middle, driven back to the bowler off the front foot
Where did that come from, Powell? Tossed full and outside off from around the wicket, Powell clears his front leg and smites it away to the wide long-on boundary for a one-bounce four
sliding into the pads, nudged through midwicket
too short on middle, Bishoo transfers his weight onto the back foot and clunks a pull past the square-leg umpire. Mpofu slides in the deep and stops the ball in the deep
full and largely holds its line outside off, Bishoo has a crease-bound prod and edges it between the keeper and slip where Hamilton dives to his right in vain
lobbed up outside off, drilled back to the bowler off the front foot
tossed on off, Powell presses forward and smothers it
full on the stumps, driven to the left of the bowler
tossed outside off, driven down to long-off now after stretching out
slides into leg stump, too full to get under it, jabbed back to the bowler
pushed through on middle, dead batted
turn and bounce outside off! Cremer finally gets it right. Perfectly pitched legbreak, Bishoo spars at it and edges between slip and gully again. Zimbabwe need more of these
dangled up outside off, Bishoo presses forward, meets the pitch and bunts it to cover
pitched up on off, defended to cover off the front foot again
on a length and spinning down the leg side, past the glance
whipped with the break to deep backward square leg
straight ball on middle, catches Powell on the crease, finds the outside edge, but it does not carry to slip again
picked off the pads to the left of midwicket for one
short legbreak, finishes on the stumps, whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
tossed outside off, Bishoo reaches out for a booming drive and skews an inside edge to short midwicket
full on the leg stump, spins down, Bishoo goes low, rolls his wrists, and sweeps competently through square leg
veering into leg stump again, easily picked off to deep midwicket
pushed through on off stump, pushed back to Cremer
prodded to short leg off the front foot. 'Something will happen folks,' is the cry from Chakabva behind the stumps
tossed up outside the leg stump, Powell winds up for a big hit. The ball loops off the pad to forward short leg
pitches outside leg and skids in to hit the pad as the batsman plays all around it
inside edged behind square on the leg side, quick fizzer at nearly 100ks
liberally tossed up outside off, Bishoo does not hold back. He sees mid-off up in the circle and lifts it through the line
run away wide of slip with soft hands now
too full and straight, whipped away to deep midwicket
full on middle, forward and smothered
low full-toss on off, Bishoo aims a drive. Instead, he slices it down to mid-off
legbreak on middle and leg, prodded through point with minimal feet movement
more revvs on this legbreak, but the length is too short, whipped off the back foot through midwicket
Round the wicket from Raza, and this has almost as much air on it as Brathwaite was giving yesterday. But it's thumped out to the man at deep midwicket
right up to the bat once again, and it's dug out to long-on.
Raza switches back to over the wicket, and shoots this one down a little quicker and flatter outside off. Left well alone though
flighted on off stump. Powell comes aggressively forward and cracks his drive to the man at deep mid-off.

Dropped! Brendan Taylor, what's happened there? Bishoo telegraphed his slog-sweep and Cremer pushed the ball out wider. The batsman sliced under the ball and the top edge looped up into the blue ... Taylor settled underneath it, but it popped straight out of his hands as he tumbled backwards at midwicket
calm defence from Powell, tapped back to the bowler.
driven straight down the ground. Mid off gets around, but can't stop the single and that's the fifty partnership
Bishoo lunges forward in defence, the ball squirting off the outer half of the bat but into space on the off side, a single the result.
whipped off the pads, and out to deep midwicket for one more
tossed up on off, defended back to the bowler
dangled up on off, played back to the bowler
slides on outside off - as opposed to breaking away - left alone
slower through the air on middle, Powell trusts his bat in front of the pad and blocks it back to the bowler
full on the stumps, forward and driven back to the bowler, who makes a tumbling save to his right
dragged short and sliding away outside off, Bishoo opens the face and glides it through backward point
slower legbreak, spins in at off, inside-edged onto the pad as Powell prods halfway forward
Powell now presses forward, meets the pitch, and fluently drives to cover
length-ball legbreak, blocked from the crease
flatter and faster, Bishoo blocks to cover off the back foot
tossed outside off, Bishoo plays a wristy drive and directs the ball to mid-on
shortish and skidding on outside off, punched behind point off the back foot
slower offbreak outside off, but the length is short, stabbed to the right of the bowler off the back foot
tossed up on the leg stump, defended back off the back foot

Soft, soft dismissal. Bishoo simply plops a return catch. Tossed-up offbreak, on middle, not much turn, but Bishoo stays leg side of the ball. He checks his drive and gently chips it back to Raza, who provides Zimbabwe with the first breakthrough of the morning. That's a lollypop catch
low full-toss outside off, instead of smiting it to the cover fence, he drives it back to the bowler

big shout for lbw from Raza, umpire Simon Fry does not budge. Cremer chooses to challenge the on-field not-out decision. Tossed outside off and breaks back in to beat the inside edge and ping Hope on the back pad. There's a spike on UltraEdge, but it comes from the bat hitting the ground. It would have carried onto crash into leg stump but the impact was outside the line of off stump. Kyle Hope survives. Good call from Fry
short and spins in, Powell flicks off the back foot, the man at short leg interceps the ball
flatter, faster, spins in, blocked to short leg off the back foot
dangled up on off, stretches out and dead-bats it to the off side
Cremer attacks the stumps, Powell's front-foot defensive intervenes
quicker legbreak, skids in to smack the thigh pad
turn and bounce again, blocked to short leg with soft hands
looped up on off, defended to short leg off the front foot
Hope gets behind the line of this offbreak and defends to the leg side
tossed on off, not much turn, smothered off the front foot
short and spins down leg, Hope misses out again, pulling weakly to backward square leg
darted on the pads, whipped to deep square leg. He gets off the mark after seven balls
straight ball on middle, gently played back to the bowler
floated up on the leg stump, Hope stretches forward and defends it back to Cremer
tossed full on middle, Hope stays leg side of the ball and slices a drive to the covers
Hope dead-bats this very full delivery on off stump
shorter legbreak outside off, chopped to cover
Cremer attacks the stumps, Hope blocks it solidly
sharp turn for Cremer! Starts just outside off, full, snakes away, drawing the batsman into an indecisive waft, and zipping past the outside edge in the channel
darted short and outside off, cracked off the back foot to cover

shorter offbreak outside off, Powell slashes a cut, sends an outside edge flying to the left of Hamilton, who was standing up, at slip. He isn't quick enough to pouch it. He did not even get a hand to it
full on middle, defended
short, wide, scythed to backward point
on a length and turns away outside off, steered away behind point
clipped with the break to backward square leg
full on off, driven back to the bowler
tossed on off, defended solidly off the front foot
Ripper from Raza! On a length on middle and off, kicks up and fizzes past the outside edge. The batsman did well not to reach out for the ball. Great take from Chakabva behind the stumps
slower legbreak, blocked to short leg

Chakabva goes up for a caught-behind appeal. Hamilton, who took the catch at slip, isn't as confident. I'm not confident either. Slower legbreak, beats the inside edge, grazes the pad and lobs to slip. If they're asking for the lbw, the impact is outside the line

Raza strikes again, this time to trap Hope lbw. Fry raises his finger. Hope confers with Powell and asks for a review. This looks plumb, however. Fuller, quicker offbreak, shoots low as well. Hope plays back to it and misses it completely. WI lose Hope and a review. It was plumb. How plumb? Missing off and leg, and cannoning into the middle of middle. Poor review from WI
tossed outside off, forward and driven to short midwicket with aplomb
sliding into the pads, clipped away to square leg
lobbed up outside off, reaches out for an expansive drive and drags an inside edge to the midwicket region
Hope now meets the pitch and drives through the line to long-off who is in the deep
darted short and wide outside off, flayed to backward point off the back foot
flighted higher on leg stump, stretches out and drives to mid-on
Hope stays leg side of the ball and drives again, this time to mid-off
short, wide outside off, Hope gets right on top of the bounce and cracks a cut between cover and backward point
loopier on off, dead batted
Cremer sends down a googly, but the length is on the shorter side. Hope reads it and works with the turn to square leg
The batsman steps away outside leg, Cremer follows him with a full, flat dart. Jammed out to mid-off
short and spins away outside off, Raza gets away with the loose ball as Powell crunches it straight to backward point
dangled up on off, defended off the front foot
full on the stumps, Powell shimmies out and pats it to mid-on. He takes on Mire's arm, the fielder fumbles, and they secure two in the end
darted short and wide outside off, Powell nails a cut and the placement is equally good. He pierces the gap between cover and backward point
whipped off the pads to midwicket
length-ball offbreak, not as short as the batsman expected it to be, steered off the face to backward point
glanced off the pads to backward square leg
full on middle and leg, defended back off the front foot
Hope stays leg side of the ball and creams a drive to cover
full on middle, driven to cover again
short and wide outside off, Cremer has been struggling with his length all morning, cracked off the back foot to the right of backward point
full on middle, Hope bends forward in defence
slides one back in from around the stumps, Powell goes deep into the crease and turns this to the leg side
beauty. Draws him forward in the flight and gets this to spin away sharply from middle and off. So very close to the outside edge
gets to the pitch of the ball and caresses it into the gap at cover as they jog the single
sharp turn back in from outside off, this is on the shorter side so he has enough time to nudge this off the back foot
gets a good stride forward and deadbats the flighted delivery
shapes to drive, gets a thick inside edge to Cremer at short midwicket. This one dipped on him, false stroke induced.
long hop which he shapes to pull but toe-ends it to the short leg fielder, who is hit on the back side as he was taking evasive action. That must hurt. The batsman apologises immediately
lunges forward and turns this sharp-spinning legbreak towards short fine leg
nice flight, lands this on off stump. He gets a long way forward and blocks
too full, enough width as well. He crashes this straight to extra cover
slow turn back into middle and leg, defended with the spin to short square leg
spins back in to hit the top of the thigh pad as he looks to work this square on he leg side
sharp turn but a touch short, defended off the backfoot
worked with the spin to long-on

appeal for lbw off a slider but the impact was outside off, surely. He shaped to cut, also looked like he got some bat on it. A very poor review from Zimbabwe. They thought there was pad first, but they completely missed the line of the delivery. This would have missed the stumps by a long way . This was a very, very confident appeal. Slid on to brush the paid faintly and hit the top part of the bat as replays confirm. Poor review from Cremer. The wicketkeeper should have been firm in saying 'no'
drifting into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
turns this with the spin to square leg. Rolled his wrists nicely to keep it all along the ground
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, turned to short fine leg
spins back in from outside off, this is a touch short. He defends back down the pitch
right onto the backfoot as he allows to slide in and hit the bat
flicked imperiously with the spin to wide mid-on
slider that nearly beats the inside edge. Rolls of it to short leg. An inch of drift more and that would've missed the inside edge and crash into the stumps
just a short-arm jab and boy, that has travelled or what. Opens his left leg and punches this short ball into the midwicket boundary
width outside off, crashed hard to cover.
shuffles across and defends this length ball from around the stumps
gets a long way forward and bunts this tossed up delivery
pushed through quicker on off stump from around the wicket, he's back inside the crease in defence
gets this to bite away from the deck, is drawn forward as he jabs at the delivery. Beaten
right onto the back foot as he guides this slow turner to first slip
beauty. Once again the ball drifts in, hits the rough and deviates a wee bit to beat the forward prod. Phew, stunning over.
driven sweetly to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
gets a long way forward and smothers this tossed up delivery
on the shorter side, he gets across the stumps and whips this wide of midwicket
dropped! This was smashed back down the ground, straight into Cremer's hands and then bobbles out. First let off on 11, now on 85, you have to take those chances even if tough.
squeezed back to Cremer, who hurls a throw in frustration to Masakadza at first slip. He intended to throw this towards the batsman. Flew past Powell's head.
picks the googly off the hand and then opens the bat face late to steer this past slip. Neatly done
drifts in a full ball on middle, he lunges forward and blocks
slider on the stumps, much fuller in length, blocked
right back into the crease as he steers this to point
nice and full on the stumps, he lunges forward and blocks
square up by sharp turn. Plays from inside the crease, the ball spins away to skew off the outer part of the bat
enough time to use the depth of the crease and steer this away into the gap at backward point
full and swinging away from off stump, looks to squeeze this down to third man but is beaten
gets the batsman to drive by bowling this full and outside off, left alone this time
pushes outside the line of the outswinger to get a thick inside edge onto the boot. The ball deflects towards the off side and they squeeze in a quick single
prods gently forward, covers the line of the delivery and bunts this to the off side
full and far too wide outside off to get him playing, left alone
back of length delivery that holds its line after pitching outside off, left alone. Scoots low to the keeper
rocks back and cuts straight to extra cover
turn and bounce with the new ball. Jabs at an away-going delivery, lands short of slip and runs away past short third man
lunges forward to drive but lets this go in the end
slides back in to roll off the pad to short fine leg
gets across the stumps and bunts this shortish delivery to point
goes back to punch this through midwicket but ends up defending it gently. Sign of being in two minds?
good length and outside off, patted into the covers
full, wide tempter outside off, encouraging carry to the keeper, the batsman wasn't tempted

he unleashes the short ball after switching angles and makes the incision. The man at gully throws himself to his right and completes a belting catch! Great reflexes, Ervine. Throat-hunting lifter outside off from around the stumps, surprises Powell and catches him in an awkward tangle. He jumps off the ground and fends it in the air. Ervine snaps it up, diving full-length to his right from gully. Powell falls ten short of a hundred. Look at the celebration from Mpofu. He is pumped. That's also his first wicket in the series. What a way to break the duck
Mpofu welcomes Chase with a head-high lifter outside off, the batsman ducks under. Mpofu slams the gloves of Chakabva
chest-high short ball on middle, 132ks, Chase hops, skips, and fends it to where short leg may have been
follows three short balls with a full offering on off stump, Hope reads the length and keeps it out. What a cracking over
has he nicked this? Drift and spin away, he wanted to poke at it but let it go at the last moment. Woah, plenty happening
defends off the back foot to the off side. Kept a touch low
goes back deep into the crease and wrists this against the spin to midwicket. This one skid on
lunges forward and smothers the spin
whips this into the midwicket boundary. Too short, he picked the length, transferred the weight back and cracked it away. Freebie
fires in a yorker-length delivery which Chase squeezes back to the bowler
touch ahead of length outside off, left alone

raps him on the pad but it may have been too high. Mpofu kept pitching it full and then had one skid on from short of length on middle. He looks to whip it but is beaten for pace and is hit on the flap of the pad. Would have been a handy review if they had one in the bag
floats this full on the stumps from wide of the crease, defended back down the pitch
full and angling into middle and leg, picks it away towards midwicket
deceived by the slower delivery, remove the bottom hand off the grip as he turns this to the leg side
hops across and pulls this all along the ground from way outside off towards deep fine leg

this is a gift of a delivery that has been slapped over mid-off. Perhaps slipped out of Chisoro's hand as he spears in a high full toss outside off, enough width as well and he swung through to clear the infield. Didn't time it well, but didn't matter
too full on middle and leg, he lunges forward and blocks
slider on middle and off, punched back to the bowler
much fuller on the stumps, squeezed back towards the bowler
full and angling in from around the stumps, blocked
pushed through quicker outside off, gets some bit off the pitch, defended carefully
back of length delivery on off stump, he hops back into the crease and blocks
short of length delivery outside off, he sways out of the way
bangs in a short ball on middle, Chase is well back into the crease as he fends with a loose grip. Excellent technique
short ball aimed at the rib cage, Chase somehow manages to avoid it again
slower and fuller outside off, watched through to the keeper
cuts back in as he defends this slightly fuller delivery to the off side. Went off the pad and rolled to the off side
slides back in to roll off an inside edge to short leg. Wasn't all that convincing in his footwork
squares him up with a peach. This one rips the surface and leaves him late
right back into the crease as he bunts this into the off side
right to the pitch of the ball as he drives to cover
nice and full delivery drifting into middle and leg, smothered

hits Chakabva on the chest as he fumbles the gather. This is stunning piece of bowling. Nice flight and loop, draws him forward to drive. Chase goes through with the drive but the ball spins away to beat the outside edge. The backfoot was just on the crease, the fumble allowed him the split-second to get back

so what if this is the last over before lunch? If it's there to be hit, he'll go through. Not entirely to the pitch of the ball but he clears his front leg and lofts this high and handsome, into the sightscreen.
sharp turn from off stump, blocked
punches this shortish delivery to extra cover
whips this full delivery towards midwicket. Not entirely in control but they'll be back for the third. Looked like this came off a thick inside edge. Wanted to hit this towards mid-on
driven back to the bowler as he makes some room
gentle offering off the last delivery before lunch: a full toss outside off and he belts this through extra cover.
really full on off, too full for Chase to get under it and drive it. Sliced to the covers
length ball, starts outside off, spins away slightly, no shot
tossed wider outside off, Chase goes for a big drive, and slices to point this time
full and straight on middle, dead batted
round-arm dart, fired into the pads, Chase falls over the flick, and misses it
Chase stays leg side of this full ball outside off and drives more firmly to cover but still can't find the gap on the off side
pretty full on middle, whipped off the front foot to midwicket
pitched up on off, angling in from over the wicket, driven back to the bowler
good length and rises outside off, Hope judges it well and leaves it be
fuller and angling into middle, presses forward and drives but can't beat short midwicket
wide of the crease and hurled into middle and leg, hastily jabbed to mid-on
Mpofu seemed to have rolled his fingers across this full one outside off. The batsman skews a drive back to the bowler
on a length and on off, Chase lets it slide off the face to cover
short, wide, four. Darted way outside off, Chase jumps back and clubs a cut through point. That flew to the boundary
short again, turns away, much closer to off, patted to backward point with an open face
tossed on middle, Chase slinks away outside the leg stump and drives the ball to cover
fast skidder outside off, doesn't turn or drift, left alone
shorter and outside off, clipped down to wide long-on
full and wide outside off, Chase eyes up a booming drive but is nowhere close to the pitch of this delivery. Miscues the drive back to Mpofu
good length and outside off, Chase presses forward and opens the face to pierce the gap at cover
floated full and outside off, Hope shelves the drive and lets it go
fuller than a good length and outside off again, no shot again
back of a length on a sixth-stump line outside off, ignored again
Mpofu probes away outside off, Hope keeps ignoring these
short and outside off, Chase gets on top of the bounce and crisply punches a single to sweeper cover
full and angling into middle from wide of the crease, Hope gets behind the line and blocks to cover
half-tracker outside off, duly put away to the wide long-on boundary with a pull. He skips back and pummels it with all his might
skidding into the leg stump, deflected behind square on the leg side
back of a length on middle, swatted away past the right of long-on off the back foot
tossed outside off, forward, meets the pitch, and eases a single to sweeper cover

just short of a good length and outside off, Hope unleashes a rasping cut, but PJ Moor throws himself to his right from backward point and saves two runs for the hosts. Mpofu warmly applauds the fielder
full and swerving into middle and leg, driven straight to short midwicket
overpitched and outside off, Hope leans into a drive and crunnnnnnches it through the covers. That's dismissive
full and tight on off, not a driveable length, worked to midwicket
short on off stump, swivels on the back foot and rolls his wrists to long leg
back of a length and nips back into a steady block on off
drifts into middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
on a length and skids into middle, hastily glanced off the pad to short fine leg
tossed on off, Hope stretches out and carves a drive to deep point for one
tossed up outside off, he stays leg side of the ball and drives down to mid-off hanging back
dangled up on middle, dead batted
much fuller and faster on off, defended off the front foot
full and wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off - no shot from Chase
Mpofu unfurls the slower offcutter, 117ks, breaks back in and beats the inside edge as Chase stabs at it early
rising delivery on the leg stump, Chase rides the bounce, uses the pace, and glances it fine of long leg. Easily put away, and there's the fifty stand off just 84 balls
full and sliding into the pads, picked off to long leg
full and angling into the leg stump, manoeurved into the vacant spaces at midwicket
full and speared into the pads, chipped in the air to the right of midwicket
short and wide outside off, he rocks back and slaps this to deep point
nicely tossed up on middle, he stretches forward and defends

Dropped. He's got iron gloves at the moment. This one drifts in, pitches on middle and rips away to take the outside edge. The keeper grabbed at the delivery and put down a straightforward chance. Oh, dear.
excellent decision from Simon Fry. Big appeal for lbw but this one spun away and took the inside edge as he shuffed across to defend.
nice flight, just around off, he lunges forward and blocks
drifts in a quicker delivery on middle and leg, squeezed to extra cover
flatter one on middle and leg, defended from the crease
turns this with the spin to backward square leg

attempts a full-blooded reverse sweep past point but misses it completely as the ball spins back in just a bit more than he expects.  The ball hits him on the roll of the pad, looks to be in line. The only question is if it may have missed the stumps. Relays suggest the impact was just in line and will stay as umpire's call. Ball tracking shows this may have just clipped leg. Lucky for Zimbabwe that it was given out on the field. They continue to chip away, this partnership was slowly beginning to turn the scales for West Indies. This is brewing quite nicely
sees it short and he swivels back to help this to the backward square leg boundary. Gift of a delivery first up, one every batsman dreams of
lobs off the thigh pad to short leg. Stifled appeal for a catch but that was more out of hope than anything else
tossed up outside off, he lunges forward and blocks
slides a full ball back in from around the stumps, Hope gets a long way forward and defends
touch short on middle and leg, whipped into the gap at midwicket
too full and sliding into middle and leg, defended with soft hands
slow turn away from leg stump, eased to square leg
nice and full on middle and leg, jabs this to the leg side
lands this short on middle from wide of the crease, enough time to punch this away past midwicket
sharp turn as the ball lobs wide of short leg off a thick inside edge. Superb bowling
gets a long way forward, defends with the bat close to the pad
sharp turn back into middle, punched to midwicket
fired full and just outside off, eased to extra cover
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends back down the pitch with the spin

punches this straight to midwicket. The sharp turn has done the trick. Blackwood just checked his shot at the last moment, the ball stopped on him just a little bit. There was a puff of dust as it hit the surface. He should've looked to pull if he wanted to go leg side. Uncertainty has resulted in his downfall. Zimbabwe are fighting back or what
gets a good stride forward and defends
width on offer, he reaches out to square drive this to the boundary rider
too full on middle, defended back
draws him forward and takes the thick edge past short third man. Super work by Raza to keep it to a single
the length allowed him enough time to defend off the back foot even though there was turn. Touch short on this occasion
too full this time, he lunges forward and deadbats this
tossed up on middle and leg, turned to short midwicket
punches this shortish delivery back to the bowler
flicks this from outside off towards midwicket. This dipped on him, but luckily he didn't hit this in the air
fired full outside off, squeezed to extra cover
gets across the stumps just a touch to cover the line of the delivery and defend
gets on top of the bounce and turns this to short leg with soft hands
on the shorter side, punched to point
past slip again! This wasn't an outright edge, the bat coming down at an angle, but he wasn't completely in control and that wasn't too far from a diving Masakadza at slip

he's got five! Raza is pumped up out there. Tremendous piece of bowling. He changed his angle, coming around the wicket, and Hope played inside the full delivery, expecting more spin than there was. The ball zipped straight on, rattling the off stump. Raza immediately set off on a celebratory sprint through the covers, mobbed by his team-mates. He's been the catalyst for Zimbabwe's surge this afternoon.
Holder stretches well forward to smother the spin, rolling his wrists over a drive to get the ball down to long on for one.
not a great delivery, landing on leg stump and turning further away. But Dowrich's flick is intercepted at square leg.
Dowrich comes half forward to push the ball back to the bowler.
Raza pushes his line a little further outside off, but Dowrich is well forward this time in defence
some excitement from Zimbabwe as this is flicked in the air towards midwicket, but it's well short. No harm done.
just short of a good length from the leggie, and Holder has plenty of time to step back and force the ball down to deep mid off.
Dowrich stays on the back foot and rides the turn and bounce, cutting to point.
fuller this time from Cremer, and with a touch more air too. Solid forward defence.

he's forward this time, and driving at a floated delivery outside off. The shot pierces the covers, and Mire hares after it ... he seems to have flicked the ball back into play as he tumbled over the boundary, but they're having another look at this. Yep, all fine. Great fielding, and he saves the boundary.
uppish! More noise in the field from Zimbabwe as Holder drives this in the air, but right through the gap at cover.
solid defence ends the over.
on a length and turns back in, keeps low, well negotiated
floated up on off, Holder uses his long reach and dead-bats it onto the pitch
faster, flatter and spins in, forced to short midwicket off the back foot
short and breaks in, Holder stands tall and punches down to long-on
tossed up invitingly outside off, Holder brings his long reach into play. Meets the pitch of this delivery and caresses it through the covers. So easy on the eye...
dangled up full and straight, tapped to short midwicket off the front foot
full on middle, Dowrich stays leg side of the ball and drives to mid-off
on a length, pitches around off and fizzes away past the outside edge. Hard-spun legbreak from Cremer
looks like a googly, the batsman has read it, clipping with the break to short fine leg
full on the stumps, blocked
darted short and wide outside off, Dowrich throws his bat at the ball and only slashes it as far as cover
dangled up on middle and leg, bunted to mid-on for a quick single. Good urgency from Holder and Dowrich
full offbreak, defended with the break to square leg
short and spins in, goes back and punches hard to short midwicket
slower through the air on off, Raza held this back, defended stoutly
shooter, scoots low at shin height on off, kept out
darted short on middle, pulled away off the back foot, but there's protection at deep midwicket
back of a length and breaks in on middle, the WI captain stands tall and punches a single down to long-on
pushed through on middle and leg, Holder stays leg side of the ball and punches to cover
another sharp legbreak. Pitches on leg and middle, rips away past the outside edge
floated full and outside off, Holder nearly chips a catch to short cover
tossed very full on middle and leg, Holder drives it to the right of mid-on
good length on middle, defended
low full-toss on middle, that's a belted birthday gift for Dowrich. He laps it up and smoothly punches it to the midwicket boundary

Raza belts out a big shout for lbw. Is that his sixth? Nope, umpire Dharmasena shoots it down. It looks pretty adjacent, though. Unfortunately, Zimbabwe don't have any reviews left. Pushed through flatter and quicker on off from around the wicket, Holder plays back to it and is pinged on the pads. Oh dear, the tracker returns three reds. There wasn't any inside edge either. Dharmasena gesticulated there might have been an inside edge
pushed through quicker, defended
down the track and punched to midwicket
straight ball on middle, blocked off the front foot
offbreak, slides down leg, beating the pull
good length and angling across, Holder plays it back to the bowler
short legbreak outside off, Dowrich skips back and cracks a cut through cover point, no sweeper to cut it off
slower through the air on the leg stump, dead batted
tossed up on middle, defended off the front foot again
short, turns away, keeps low, chopped to cover
sliding on off, blocked off the back foot
Cremer throws this up on the leg stump, poked back to the bowler
sees the flight and drills this back to Raza
too much flight, gets close to the delivery, not underneath it, and hits it back to the bowler again
whips this off his hip to short square leg as they scamper a quick single
slider across the right-hander, this one keeps a touch low but he's behind the line in defence
brings out the big mow across the line, down towards deep midwicket. Didn't time it as well as he would've liked. Initially looked to clear the ropes
gets a good stride forward and bunts this full delivery back towards the bowler
drifts in a tossed up delivery on leg stump from wide of the crease, Holder makes a bit of room and blocks
breaks away from length outside off, bunted to cover
nice drift in from wide of the crease, Holder uses his height to negate the spin and defend
attempted sweep to a full delivery sliding in. Hits the boot and lobs to short leg
goes back and across to punch this short ball back to the bowler
low full toss which he hits straight down the ground, just lands short of the bowler on his followthrough
spins back in to beat the pad, keeper does well to collect it on the second attempt down leg
opens up the leg side and pulls this long hop to the deep backward square leg boundary. Too short from Raza, very poor. Maybe a sign that he's tiring
shuffles across and looks to work this off his hip to square leg, is hit high on the thigh pad
drilled down past mid-off. Bullet hit, no chance for the man inside the ring because that was timed supremely and hit as straight as he could
fired into middle and leg, nurdles this to square leg
worked with the spin to square leg again
nice flight, lands this a touch ahead of length on off stump, defended with soft hands
gets his left leg out of the way and then allows the ball to spin away before he defends with soft hands
too short and he's clobbered that. Rocked back and muscles this to the deep midwicket fence on the bounce
full on middle, spins away as Holder defends
crisp drive but straight to short cover

tosses this up but lands this outside off, Holder had to reach out for it, which he did, and managed to drive that away uppishly over cover point. Not entirely in control but it was safe because there was no one there
too short, he punches this to midwicket
too full on off stump, defended back
plants his front foot outside the line of the stumps and blocks
goes back when he could've been forward to a full delivery, defended
crunching cover drive. Threads the gap between cover and mid-off. Delightful timing
slow turn back in, bunted down the pitch
crunches this half-volley to extra cover
yorker-length on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
lunges forward and defends this in-drifter
whips this past wide mid-on. Mpofu tries to dive but can't get any hand on it. Deep midwicket comes around to cut that off
edged bur safe. Rolls along the ground to short third man. Drawn forward by the flight
drifting into middle, he gets forward and defends with the bat close to the pad
too short on middle, punched to mid-on
slider from around the stumps, he's right back into the crease as he blocks
attempted cut, this keeps a touch low so the timing isn't there, but since he's it towards the longest area of the ground, there's enough time to come back for three
driven crisply towards deep extra cover. Got right to the pitch of the ball
swept with the spin to square leg
too full, he lunges forward and smothers the spin
too full on middle, eased to long-off for a single
spins away from off stump, eased to cover
this is a long hop which he rocks back and pulls into the gap at deep midwicket
squeezes this full delivery straight to cover
jabs this tossed up delivery to the off side
touch short, enough time to bunt this away off the backfoot
crunches this cut straight to short cover
slow turn from middle, bunted back to the bowler
too short, he rocks back and slaps this straight to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
flicked against the turn to long-on, called for two but he hit that too well
rolls his wrists to turn this length ball to short fine leg
googly which he reads off the hand, tucked to short midwicket for a quick single. That's tea
too full on off, blocked
eased with the spin to extra cover
too short, he was off balance as he shaped to cut, mistimed to point
fired full outside off, driven straight to cover
steers this short ball straight to point
low full toss drifting into the pads, bunted to mid-on
snakes back in from length outside off, hint of reverse definitely, Holder pushes at it and gets a thick inside edge towards deep square leg
angles in a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, defended back down the pitch with soft hands
saved by an inside edge. Floats this full, gets it to nip back in off the seam. Holder feels for the delivery and gets a thin edge as he looks to force this through the off side
clears his front leg and wallops this over mid-off. Timed superbly.
slower through the air, much fuller in length as well, sweetly timed to cover
pulled away in spanking fashion. Picked the length early, swivelled back and rolled his wrists over the delivery to put that away
driven with the spin to mid-off
drifting into middle and leg, tucked into the gap between midwicket and square leg
right to the pitch of the ball as he creams this half-volley to extra cover
thumped to sweeper cover on the yp
bat close to the pad as he defends this back down the pitch
sharp turn from outside off, this one kicks on from the rough, excellent leave
plays outside the line as the full delivery squeezes to mid-on off a thick inside edge
skiddy length ball which he hops back and across tro defend
driven firmly down to mid-on
fetches this pull from way outside off but doesn't get hold of it like he would've liked. Dragged to deep square leg
reverses back into middle at length, defended with a straight bat
off-cutter on off stump, reads it off the hand and readjusts to defend back down the pitch
bite off the pitch, Holder is beaten as he pokes and is beaten in flight
driven on the up to sweeper cover
in the hitting arc and Dowrich sends it soaring over the bowler's head, one bounce to the long-off boundary. Too much flight and he put that away easily. Intention was always to hit straight
drift and turn from off stump, left alone
sharp turn from off stump, he lunges forward and defends. Rolls off a thick outside edge to short third man
eased with the spin to mid-off
slow turn from off stump, defended
short, he rocks back and slaps this to deep point
slow turn from off stump, length is short, so he gets across and defends this back to the bowler
nice flight, sharp turn but  solid defence too
short and punished. Swivelled back, used the depth of the crease and pulled this all along the carpet past mid-on. Delightfully done. Picked the length early.
rocks back and cuts this into the gap at point. Waited, waited and then played it really late
nearly chopped on. Looked to force that through point but the slowness of the delivery nearly did him in
slow but sharp turn as it drifts in, defended with soft hands

square driven to bring up a welcome half-century. Pumps his fists, fighting knock. 6th Test fifty for him ! Too much flight, he leant into the drive and opened the bat face to put this away behind point
back into the crease as he bunts this back down the pitch
lunges forward and blocks
creamed away to deep cover
sharp legbreak from way outside leg, he goes back and punches this to midwicket
short-arm jab that has been effortlessly eased to deep midwicket
waits for this short ball to spin away and then eases this to mid-off
gets a long way forward and blocks
spins away from outside leg, Holder defends with the bat close to the pad
full toss outside leg, Holder flicks this to deep square to keep strike
short and wide outside off, Holder chops hard but straight to cover
Chisoro throws it up full and wide outside off, no shot
tossed outside off and spins away further, Holder has an almighty slash at it... and misses
drifts in and dips at off stump, Holder lets the ball slide off the face to point
full and outside off, driven through the line to cover
tossed wider outside off, Holder cracks it wide of the off-side sweeper
fired on leg from around the wicket, Holder drives inside out to long-off
pitches outside leg, padded away behind square
starts outside leg again, Dowrich blocks square on the leg side
pushed through on leg stump, forward-defensive
Dowrich gets his front leg out of the line and defends it
sliding across off from around the wicket, blocked off the back foot
pushed through outside off, 85ks, left alone
even fuller and outside off, Holder flashes a drive to backward point
dangled up on off, forward-defensive
another forward-defensive to this tossed-up ball on off stump
darted short and wide outside off, Holder shifts his balance onto the back foot and laces the ball through the covers
short and wide outside off, flayed away to the off-side sweeper for one
Pushed through on leg stump from around the wicket, dips, and turns, beats Holder even as he employs a long stride
Holder eyes up a reverse sweep now, Cremer darts a legbreak outside leg and beats him again
starts outside leg and breaks away, poked wide of slip
tucked off the pads to short fine leg
WI snatch the lead in Bulawayo! Full ball, pitches outside leg, patted to square leg
another one that pitches outside leg as Cremer aims to target the footmarks, defended
back of a length and fired on middle and leg, Holder blocks to short leg off the back foot
blocked to short leg again
straight ball on middle, Holder lunges forward and defends
back of a length on leg stump, swatted off the back foot to deep midwicket
Raza straightens his line, full, defended back
dragged down on middle and leg, pulled hard to deep square leg
slid down leg, left alone
pitches outside leg and skids on, kicks away with the pad
short and pitches way outside leg, beats the pull
full outside leg, driven down to long-on. That brings up the century stand
short on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
tossed up on the leg stump, Holder pre-meditated a reverse sweep. He sends it away through backward point. He brings up an adventurous fifty with an adventurous stroke
flighted on middle, defended
short on off, whipped to midwicket off the back foot
full on off, played back to the bowler
pushed through on off, defended back again
tossed up higher outside off, driven to cover
full on middle, defended back
pitches outside leg and turns, Holder stretches out and blocks back to Cremer
short legbreak, starts outside leg and ends on middle, thumped down to long-off
driven off the pads to short midwicket
pushed through outside leg, Dowrich goes low, and hammers a sweep to the right of deep square leg
flighted outside leg, Holder keeps it out
picked from outside leg and stroked to deep midwicket off the front foot
floated up outside off, Holder eases a drive to mid-off
flat and short on middle, Holder clears his front leg, winds up. He has T20'd it to the right of long leg
tossed on middle, Holder gallops down the track, meets the pitch and clouts it straight of long-on. Nice, clean strike from the WI captain. Great connection
Holder now opens the face and drives from outside off to cover. It was too full for him to get underneath the length
worked off the pads to short leg
good length and angling away outside off, nearly shaves the outside edge
too full and drifting in, squeezed back to the bowler
driven with the spin to sweeper cover
slow turn from middle, defended as he prods forward
too much flight, he gets to the pitch of the ball and belts this to deep cover. Raza at cover, got some hand on that to take the pace off
once again a long hop which Holder slaps to sweeper cover
this is a tired delivery. Short, he pulls it from way outside off to deep midwicket
another short ball sliding into middle and leg, pulls straight to backward square leg
slow turn from middle and leg, tucked to short midwicket
tossed up on middle, he gets a long way forward and blocks
opens up the legside and whips this short ball to deep midwicket
slider that drifts across the batsman, Holder punches this to short mid-on
gets half-forward and defends this with soft hands
goes back and across as he defends this short ball back to the bowler
too much flight, he's well forward in defence again
googly which bounces from the rough on middle, nurdled to the leg side
too full and drifting into middle and leg, worked wide of mid-on
width and he's belted this full delivery straight to cover
spins away from outside off, left alone
slow turn back into middle, bunted to the legside
slider on off stump, defended from the crease
bowls a legbreak but he lands this too short, Dowrich makes some room and crashes this to the point boundary.
sharp turn back in, defended gently
gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin
tucked with the spin with soft hands
friendly short of length delivery outside off, punched to cover
nibbles away from length outside off, slapped to point where a halfstop gives them a single
cut away in front of square to deep point
short and wide outside off, cut away to deep cover again
uses the bowler's pace to steer this into the gap behind point, laboured effort from Mpofu
excellent take down leg. Masakadza slides this full delivery into the batsman, who misses the tickle.
works this with the spin to square leg
nicely forward as he eases this with the spin to long-on
slow turn into middle and leg, looks to tickle this fine but he played too early, keeper fumbles as he gathers down leg
gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin
too full on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
on the shorter side, he hops across and punches this back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, punched sweetly to sweeper cover
full nip-backer, takes the inside edge and rolls away to the square-leg region
just short of a good length on middle, Holder unfurls a velvet-smooth punch to long-on
floated full and straight, Dowrich presses forward and bunts the ball to short midwicket
skiddy full ball outside off, left alone in the channel
full and on off, clipped to short midwicket
pretty full on off stump, eased to long-off off the front foot
angling across off, forward and smothered
back of a length and hits the thigh pad as Dowrich can't make contact with a pull
whipped off the pads to deep square leg
tucked around the corner
nudged to the right of square leg again
full and swings in, Dowrich falls over the flick. But he manages an inside edge onto the pad... or not. Heading down leg definitely
full and tailing in on middle, squirted to midwicket
full and holds its line outside off, ignored
full and on off, Dowrich presses forward and pushes back to the bowler
pitched up on off, Dowrich presses forward and shows the full face of the ball, driving to the right of Hamilton
tight line on off, Dowrich responds with an equally tight defence to cover
dangled up on the leg stump, dead batted
sliding around off, defended
back of a length on the leg stump, Holder stands tall and forces to square leg where the fielder fumbles
skidding across off, no shot in the channel
darted short on the leg stump, firmly pulled to deep midwicket off the back foot
tossed up and moving across off with the angle, Holder feels for it, and is beaten in the channel. Lovely delivery from Raza, but not a wicket-taking one
floated full and reversing into a tight forward defensive back to Hamilton
short and wide outside off, Dowrich throws his bat at a cut... and misses
back of a length and on off, Dowrich hangs back and blocks the ball to mid-on
pitched up and outside off, 109ks, Dowrich shelves the drive and lets it go
another gentle inswinger, blocked off the front foot to the leg side
Dowrich leans into a flowing drive to mid-off. This was pitched full and outside off
full and curves in on off, pushed to mid-on
full and veering into the pads, clipped away to deep square leg. And umpire Fry catches Mire overstepping. It's a biiiig no-ball from the allrounder
back of a length on the hips, directed to long leg
full on off, Holder lets it slice off the face to backward point
back of a length and angling into a solid push to mid-off
short and wide outside off, Holder reaches out for the ball and carves it straight to extra cover
back of a length and on middle and leg, clipped away straight to square leg. It caps a wicketless session
gets a length ball to nip back in just a wee bit from outside off, solidly defended
full and angling in towards the stumps from wide of the crease, Dowrich defends with soft hands
just short of Taylor at short midwicket. Mpofu gets this to tail back in, bounces off the deck to hit Dowrich high on the bat as he looks to defend. Checked his shot at the last moment
prods half-forward and bunts this good length delivery into the off side
first runs of the morning. Pitched up and sliding into the pads, neatly flicked all along the carpet to deep midwicket.
pushes outside the line of this length ball that snakes back in, the ball rolls off a thick inside edge to square leg. West Indies lead by 50 now
nice flight, lands this just around off stump, Holder gets forward and deadbats that
touch short this time, punched to extra cover
forced off the back foot to extra cover. Tumbling stop there. Timed it beautifully
doesn't get to the pitch of the ball but still manages to drive through to extra cover
too short, he gets across and whips this from outside off towards midwicket
there's cover and point. Dowrich rocks back and opens the bat face slightly to steer this short ball into the gap there
short of length ball that jags back in from around the fifth stump, left alone. This one kept a touch low
steered away into the gap behind point. This was too full, he opened the bat face to play it down there to squeeze out two more
full and tailing in from wide of the crease, defended gently towards mid-on
back of length delivery way outside off, Dowrich shoulders arms
floats this full on off stump, Dowrich shows the full face of the bat in defence

big, big appeal for lbw but the impact may have been outside off. Dowrich prods half-heartedly to a delivery that tails back in again but he attempted to get his left pad outside the line and was on the move. No review left. Dowrich was looking to play this towards the on side
too full and wide outside off, smeared to sweeper cover
sharp turn to this quicker delivery from outside off, left alone

squared up as he looks to work this to the leg side. The ball drifts back in, pitches outside leg and spins away to hit him on top of the right thigh. Stifled lbw appeal but they knew it was a very optimistic one
floated full and around off stump, defended with soft hands
on the shorter side, he rocks back and bunts this to the off side
pushed through quicker, lands this just outside off. The ball spins away further as Dowrich leaves

nearly chopped on! Luck continues to favour Holder. This is a touch short outside off, Holder looks to smash the cover of the ball as he shapes to go for a cut. The ball kept a touch low and got a thickish inside edge as it raced past the stumps to the fine leg boundary
angles in a full-length delivery on middle, Holder shows the full face of the bat in defence
slows his pace down, lands this off-cutter just around off stump, Holder solidly defends
late inswing thanks to the reverse, Holder hits this straight back down the ground. This was headed right towards Dowrich, who jumped to watch the ball whizz through to mid-on from between his legs
prods outside the line of this length ball that reverses back in to roll back off the inner half of the bat
text book defence to a full delivery angling in.
drifts in a full delivery towards leg stump, squeezed to mid-on
gets a good stride forward and defends. Nearly beaten by the drift as the ball rolls off an inside edge towards short leg
too short, this has been a problem for Cremer. Rocks back and steers this to deep point to get off strike
breaks away sharply and keeps a touch low to beat the outside edge as Holder gets across to defend
shapes to cut, this time he's beaten by the bounce. This gripped the surface and took off, so he was beaten even though there was plent of width

Chakabva makes a mess of another opportunity. Dropped! Lots of air, he lands this outside off and lures Holder to go for the big booming drive, which he does, only to get a thick edge. This would've gone down Masakadza's throat at first slip but Chakabva went for it and fluffed it. Hard hands. In and out. His poor game behind the stumps continues.
eased with the spin to mid-off for an easy single
drifts in a full delivery from around the stumps, defended
gets a good stride forward and bunts this in-drifter to the off side
fires in a slider which is a touch short, defended back down the pitch
too full and he's laced this into the acres of open space at deep extra cover. Wide long-off comes around to cut that off
spins away but keeps a touch low, he mistimes an attempted cut to short cover
gets forward and defends this tossed up delivery. Wanted to work this towards the leg side but the ball spins away to skew to off
drifting into middle and leg, he gets forward and across as he smothers the spin
slices this cut to point. Wanted a single but excellent work from Raza to prevent one
this time it's the wrong'un which Dowrich didn't read in the air. He was initially shuffling across to cut but adjusted late to tuck this away with the angle past short fine leg
too full on  middle, Dowrich gets a good stride forward and blocks
touch short, so there's enough time to play for the turn. Bunted to the off side
slider into middle and leg, tucked towards square leg
cuts but this one isn't all that wide, so he gets a thick edge that races past short third man
sharp turn from outside off, left alone this time
fired full on off from around the stumps, Holder is solid in defence
too full and he's crashed that straight to sweeper cover
eased with the spin to mid-off
too much flight as he lands this outside off, driven down to long-off as they jog the single
sharp turn from outside off, left alone
nice and full on middle, Dowrich lunges forward and dabs this to the off side
gets a long way forward and blocks this tossed up delivery again
flipper that keeps a touch low, but the line was outside off. Dowrich works it against the line to midwicket
drills this drive to deep extra cover for an easy single
full but way outside off, so even though this shapes away, it doesn't matter as Holder leaves this harmless delivery
beaten. The late banana swing results in a nervous poke. Holder is opened up as he plays with little conviction. No feet movement whatsoever
nips away from good length outside off, left alone. This one zips through to the keeper
lands this a touch ahead of length on off stump, defended with an angled bat to the point region
back of length delivery outside off, this one's left alone
draws him forward with the length, Holder gets forward and eases this to mid-off
nicely flighted on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
pitches on off and straightens, Dowrich covers the line and defends
pitched up and put away without much fuss. The timing on it was so pristine that the slow outfield didn't matter. Right to the pitch of the ball as he crashed this into the extra cover region
sharp turn back into middle, he shortens is length just a little bit, turned to the leg side
fired full on off stump, Dowrich lunges forward and blocks
shuffles across and bunts this quicker delivery to the leg side
late movement back in as Holder gets a thick inside edge down to long leg

another big shout for lbw. Boy, you have to say this was really, really close. The full delivery snakes back in to hit Dowrich on top of the pad. He was overbalanced in trying to work that to the leg side. Replays suggests it may have been umpire's call if there was a review Good decision from Dharmasena
ducks under this attempted short ball under the stumps
shortens his length just a touch, Dowrich still manages to get forward and defends
excellent bouncer towards the arm pit. Dowrich gets on top of the bounce and fends this to the leg side
short ball on off stump, he goes back deep into the crease and bunts this to the off side
lands this quicker one on middle and off, Holder prods forward and keeps that out
squeezes this full delivery towards the point region, keeper runs across to stop that
drifts away a full delivery, laced into the gap at cover
just a gentle push forward as he smothers the spin in defence
plays for the turn but the ball skids across to beat the outside edge. Scooted low, excellent take by the keeper. Bishoo would've watched that with great interest
full and sliding away, Holder goes for a full-blooded drive but gets a thick outside edge that races to the third man boundary. Into the 90s
full delivery on middle, defended back down the pitch
full and just outside off, the angle got the ball to jag in a bit, Dowrich defends from the crease
full and just outside off, guides this towards gully
steers this short of length delivery towards point
attempted bouncer on the stumps, Dowrich gets on top of the bounce and bunts this to the off side
slower delivery but the length is on the shorter side, he bunts this with an angled bat to third slip
slides back in and keeps a touch low but Holder is firmly behind the line of the delivery in defence
lunges forward and then angles this past slip. Down to the third man region for two easy runs
fired full on the stumps, Holder, standing square on, works this to midwicket
right to the pitch of the ball as he drives this to long-off
into the gap at extra cover as he drives firmly again
how close was that to an lbw? Kept really, really low. Holder just about manages to get some bat on that. This was on the stumps and he would've been stone dead had he missed it.
full on middle, shuffles and punched off the front foot to mid on
gets inside the line of the delivery and defends off the back foot. Pitched back of a length just outside off
keeps it back of a length outside off stump, punched off the back foot straight to Mpofu
starts off with a short one, pitches outside leg and angles into his body, tiptoes and defends off the back foot
short once again, pitches outside leg and sends Dowrich ducking
back of a length outside leg, lets it come through to his body and defends from chest high

sharp offspin after pitching just outside off, the batsman had prodded forward to defend it, and the ball just zips past his bat's inside edge and raps him in front of middle. But the umpire thinks it would've gone down the leg side. Big appeal however
full outside off, edged past first slip along the ground
very full outside off, flighted up and driven straight to cover
goes full once again, tries to give it some more air, tapped to mid off once again
full wide outside off, prods forward and defends off the front foot. Says no to a single
full on middle and leg, big stride forward and tapped towards the leg side
full on middle stump, comes forward and defends once again. Patient
wide outside off, stays slightly low but Holder manages to punch this towards cover, Raza dives over it, and the batsmen are allowed to complete the single
back of a length outside off, carved away straight to point
just misses leg stump! quicker one pitches outside leg, Dowrich tries to sweep but he's not fast enough for it, misses the shot completely. Inches past leg stump

good length outside off and enough width for Dowrich to glance that with an open bat towards the deep on the off side. PJ Moor, in the deep, does well to dive and stop the boundary. Slid through and stopped the ball from rolling into the boundary ropes
goes straight through after pitching outside off, Dowrich plays down the wrong line expecting the spin, Chakabva can't gather it either
full outside off, big stride in and driven down the ground to long on

full on off stump, tries to glance this down the leg side but hits him on the pad instead. Big appeal for Raza, and the umpire says no. It hit him in front of middle, but might just have been missing the stumps. Tight according to the naked eye
full on off stump, tapped down the long on for an easy run. Moves onto 98
back of a length just outside off, gets big on Dowrich after pitching, unconvincingly tapped away towards short fine leg off his back foot
full on middle, worked off the front foot on the leg side. Straight to midwicket. Drinks
full on middle, forces Holder to come forward and get bat to ball. Quick one, 90kph
full on middle and off again, comes forward and defended
there's the hundred for Holder! Extravagantly driven past cover and isn't Holder delighted. Fist pump as soon as the ball passes the infielders and a jump to go with it.
full on middle and leg, worked past midwicket for a single
quick and flat on middle and leg, goes down the leg side. Dowrich was slow to it however
goes deep into the crease and nudges this past the square-leg umpire for more runs. Dowrich wants the third, and he will get it. Dowrich on 96
full on middle, little bit of legspin, defended off the front foot

And what a way to get your maiden Test hundred! It was pitched up outside off stump and it's been dispatched over long off. Cremer gives it a lot of air, Dowrich does not miss out. Great contact and straight over the bowler's head. Big hug from Holder to his partner
good length on middle, worked towards midwicket off the back foot
driven straight to cover, full on off
that's another biggie! Full followthrough of the bat, it's full and Holder can get his bat under the delivery, off the middle of the bat and flies over deep extra cover

gives it flight once again outside off but this time he can't make the necessary contact. Bat turned in his hand while he tries to slog this over cover once again. The ball flies over to the leg side instead
full on off stump, driven past the non-striker to mid on
full just outside off, comes forward and defends
well fielded by short fine leg, full on leg stump and Dowrich was down on one knee in a flash to sweep this fine
full on off, defended towards cover off the front foot
short outside off, enough room to cut but can't get the gap. Straight to point

full on middle and leg, and hits him on the pad. Misses the sweep this time and hits him in front of leg. Big appeal, and the umpire says out! Dowrich reviews. Chisoro has to wait for the third umpire before celebrating his maiden Test wicket. No bat for certain, pitched on leg and would've gone straight through to hit leg stump. Chisoro can finally celebrate the special moment. Dowrich has to go. The record stand finally broken
drifts onto leg stump, clipped off his toes to deep midwicket
flighted on middle, big stride forward and defend. Well negated
flighted outside off, the wrong'un this time, defends it off the front foot
tossed up full outside off, pushed off the front foot to short cover
flatter this time and spins just Roach's outside edge and into Chakabva's gloves. Tentatively defended and just sneaks past his outside edge

full on middle, goes straight through and he defends off the wrong line expecting the ball to spin, smacks him on the pads and Zimbabwe go up for the lbw. The umpire says no, reckon it would've gone down leg
full on off, tapped off the front foot with the bat's full face
very wide and full outside off, the ball spins further away and Holder lets it go through
skids through this time, full outside off and Holder leaves
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
very full outside off, pitches beyond the crease and hits the keeper's pads

He's bowled around his legs! Back of a length outside leg and the attempted sweep gets another victim for Chisoro. Tried to paddle this past short third man but the ball goes under his bat, and breaks leg stump. Holder is disappointed as he leaves the ground. The change of angle worked and how!
flighted full outside off, defended off the front foot
full outside off again, spins past the batsman's attempted defense through to the keeper
flighted full just outside off, defended once again. Minimal movement of the feet however
tossed up once again, defended off the front foot
wild turn this time, tossed up outside off, and big legspin away. Chakabva gathers from just inside the wide marker
back of a length outside leg stump, big stride forward and pads it while trying to defend
tries to toss it up outside off but it's a low full toss eventually, muscled away to deep midwicket
good length outside off, spins away from Roach as he shoulders his arms
big stride forward and left alone once again, full outside off
flatter outside off, tries to drive through the offside but takes the inside edge past the keeper
good length outside off, goes straight through to the keeper

just past the outside edge! This is the one that goes straightens after pitching, back of a length on off stump, and sneaks just past his outside edge. Went deep into the crease in an attempt to tap this off the back foot
starts off with the wrong'un, defended
drifts and lands on middle and leg, defends the full-pitched delivery off the front foot
lifted over the bowler's head for a boundary! tossed up and lands on off stump, big followthrough and over long on's head
back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot
goes back of a length again, outside edge along the ground to second slip
outside off, goes straight through to the keeper. No attempt of a shot from the batsman
takes the outside edge, but one-bounce to first slip. Full outside off and defended

full on off stump, and stays low this time! Back of a length on off stump, this is the straight one and plumb in front of middle. Umpire Dharmasena confirms Chisoro's appeal for lbw. Third duck in three innings for Roach. West Indies all out for 448.

reduce the 122-run deficit by four. This is a gentle half-volley outside off and Masakadza blasts this through extra cover. No fear whatsoever. So what if there's just 25 minutes left for lunch. Emphatic start
this one hags back in from length on middle to hit Masakadza high on the thigh pad as he plays all around it
floats in a full-length delivery on middle from wide of the crease, solidly defended back down the pitch
shortens his length just a little, lands this on middle, defended back down the ground
excellent leave. Probes away at length outside off, this jags back in just a touch but Masakadza wants nothing to do with this one
short of length outside off, watched through to the keeper again
gets a good stride forward and bunts this full-length delivery to short cover
uppish but into the gap between cover and mid-off. Authoritative from Mire
chops this cut shot to the keeper. Looked to blast this off the frontfoot but was cramped for room
plays outside the line of this incoming length ball to get a thick inside edge onto the pad
looks to play the short-arm jab but once again the ball skids back in a long way to beat him for pace and hit him on the thigh pad
positive feet movement. Gets a good stride forward and defends this full-length delivery
bends his back and bowls a skiddy length ball in from wide of the crease, Masakadza defends
leaves this in-dipper delivered outside off from wide of the crease
angles this in and gets the ball to move away after pitching outside off, Masakadza leaves
length ball outside off, gets this to shape away, watched through to the keeper
hustled for pace as he looks to fend this sharp bounce, the inside edge rolls towards the legside as they scamper a run. That was bowled at 142kph
beauty that leaves him late. Squared up by the length, the ball whizzes past the outside edge
floats a full-length delivery on middle from wide of the crease, Masakadza squeezes it to the off side
back of length delivery on middle, Masakadza is back and across as he defends this back down the pitch

flattens the off stump with an in-ducker. The first-innings centurion has paid the price for erring in judgment. He goes from wide of the crease and lands this length ball around the fifth stump, lands this on the seam and gets it to jag back in a long, long way. Masakadza attempts to leave but is shocked to hear the ball rattle into the stumps. Body blow for Zimbabwe early in their second innings.
sucked him into the drive, beaten. Floated this full, got this to move away late. Ervine was through with the stroke with minimal feet movement.
nice and full around off stump, defended to short cover
crunching drive to extra cover as they scamper a single. Holder fires a throw at the striker's end
full and just around off, Ervine is half-forward as he defends
fires one in from around the stumps, blocked

predetermines a sweep and is struck on the pad. This drifted in from around the stumps, may have been saved by a bottom edge. Yes, some glove too on it before it went onto the pad. Not the most-ideal stroke to be playing
tossed up outside off, Ervine gets a long way forward and blocks
pushed through quicker on middle, defended back to the bowler
flayed away into the deep extra cover region, good work by Bishoo, who was on the move before a late decision to tumble across
punched down the ground but a good stop by Roach on his followthrough
shows the full face of the bat in defence to this full delivery

oh, dear. I don't know what Mire was thinking. This is a length ball that angles back in from wide of the crease, Mire looks to pull off the frontfoot but the ball zipped past his stroke to hig him on the right thigh. Since this kept a touch low, it was pretty adjacent and would've crashed into the stumps. A pull shot against an express bowler to a not-so-short delivery with lunch just a few minutes away? Very poor. Zimbabwe end a shocker of a session with another blow in their bid to wipe out the deficit.
a loose one to start off, full and wide outside off. Stays low as the ball goes through to the keeper

big appeal from Roach for lbw, the umpire says no. Full on middle and leg, and raps Taylor on the pads as he tries to flick towards midwicket. It would've gone down leg anyway. Roach and Holder considered reviewing momentarily there
full on off, defended off the front foot
full on middle, pitches ahead of Taylor's toes and timely clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, angles into Taylor's body. Defended off the back foot
full once again and clipped off his toes once more, this time past midwicket's right. Good use of the wrists to find the gap. The infielders have to give it a chase, retrieved just inside the ropes
full on off stump, digs it out
full on middle again, angles into him. Tapped square on the leg side, but straight to midwicket
full on middle and leg, angles down the leg side even before Ervine could decide what shot he wanted to play

Big appeal for lbw from Roach, not out says the umpire. They're going up for the review. It was full on off and the batsman came forward to defend, and in real-time it seemed like it was bat-pad. Replays, however, suggest it was pad first. Impact is outside off, and despite the ball hitting middle, it's not out. They lose a review.
back of a length outside off, driven on the up past cover
full on the fourth-stump line outside off stump, small shuffle of the feet and defended off the front foot
back of a length just outside off, lets the ball go through to the keeper
back of a length on middle, tapped towards the leg side in front of square for a single
back of a length outside off, shoulders his arms this time.
short outside off, enough width for the cut but chooses to leaves it alone. Good carry through to Dowrich
full outside off, pushed to cover off the front foot. The fielder has to run to his right, and is agile enough to get down in time and stop that well-timed shot
full on off stump, angles into his body this time. He walks across the stumps, coming inside the line of the delivery, and taps it back to Gabriel
full on middle, worked off his pads to square-leg.
back of a length outside off, one of those deliveries that stays arbitrarily low, left alone
tries the short one this time, not bouncing enough off the pitch to trouble Taylor. Solidly defended off the back foot
full outside off stump, sticking to this line from around the wicket, once again Ervine chooses to defend
full outside off, big stride forward before choosing to shoulder his arms

short outside off, Ervine plays for the bounce, but it stays low. Tries to muscle this towards the leg side, but the bat turns in his hand, takes the toe-end of the bat and dribbles away towards mid on
