full on off stump, small step forward and defended
back of a length outside off stump, stays in his crease and defends this from top of off stump
back of a length outside off, the blockade continues. Defended off the back foot towards short cover. Maiden over
back of a length outside off, quicker one to begin the over with, gets inside the delivery's line and punched off the back foot back to the bowler
full on middle, drifts onto his pads and tucked away easily past midwicket. It's well timed and races away for four
full outside off, punched off the front foot to mid off
full outside off, steps forward and defended off the front foot. Keeps his eyes on the ball and displays the bat's full face
back of a length outside off and once again that low bounce. Tries to defend but takes the bottom-edge and hits him on the pad. The inside-edge could've easily gone on to break the stumps
back of a length outside off, well left as the ball goes through to Dowrich
back of a length outside off once again, doesn't angle into the left hander. Goes straight through
uppishly driven, falls just short of mid off. Full outside off and this time Ervine chooses to drive this time. Shouts of catch it, but unfortunately for the visitors, just short of Holder
full on off stump, walks across to the off side and punched past mid on. Full extension of the arms, and played very straight. Just stopped by mid on before it hit the ropes
good length outside off, front-foot defense offered and takes bat-pad. Holder appeals for the lbw, but turned down
full outside off, Taylor quick to decide that he's leaving this one

big shout for lbw! Turned down. Good-length delivery pitching just outside off, slightly extra bounce this time and the batsman misses his whip off his pads. Hits him above his knee roll in front of middle. Would've drifted down leg, and replays show it was an inside edge as well
back of a length on middle, cramps him slightly but manages to punch off the back foot
full outside off, tries to push towards mid off but takes the inside edge of the bat and flies towards the leg side, big gap between bat and pad as he tried to play at it. Through the drive too early
back of a length just outside off, defended off the front foot
overpitched outside off stump, tries to drive but can't time it well, takes the toe-end of the blade and the ball dribbles back to the bowler
full on off, slightly slower delivery (124kph), defended with very soft hands this time

Hits Taylor on his elbow! Short on off and he tries to duck, but the ball stays low and the batsman is in the line of the delivery. He's in an awkward position, and tries to fend the ball with his left arm. Smacks him on the elbow guard
back of a length outside off, quick to go deep into the crease and defended
good length on off, angles into his pads, tucked square on the leg side. But straight to the fielder at short midwicket
full on off, defends off the front foot but takes the outside edge. Flies along the ground to wide-ish second slip
short and wide, enough room to bring out the cut. It's timed well too, but doesn't have the direction. Straight to point
full on middle, loopy release this time, gets inside the line of the ball and defends. Slightly overbalanced while playing the shot. Was falling over it
full on off stump, driven towards mid on
angles a full-length delivery on middle from wide of the crease, dug out to the leg side
flicked uppishly but into the gap at square leg. Looked like he checked his stroke at the last minute in an attempt to keep it down, but couldn't. Luckily it spun away from where a leg umpire stands.
gets this full delivery to straighten after pitching on off stump, Taylor defends down the ground
back of length delivery on middle, defended solidly
slower length ball outside off, Taylor hops across and defends

he's been probing away and has now been rewarded with the wicket of the big fish. It's the in-dipper again. Coming back in from just a touch outside off, Taylor looks to defend from the crease but plays outside the line as the ball nips back in to beat the inside edge and trap him plumb in front of the stumps. Taylor knew he was a dead duck and so didn't even bother reviewing that. Zimbabwe in some trouble now.
floats this full on off stump from wide of the crease, Ervine gets behind the line and blocks
edged but it rolls quickly towards gully. Played that with soft hands
shows the full face of the bat in keeping out that full-length delivery on off stump
squared up by the length. Angled in, hit the deck and left him late. Scooted low to the keeper. Ervine unsure of his defence still, especially when he's pushed back.
prods forward and bunts this length ball on off to the cover region
thick edge that rolls all along the ground to the third man boundary. This was between keeper and gully. Not deliberate but at least he played with soft hands
minimal feet movement with the off stump exposed as he looks to negotiate this yorker-length ball. Luckily for him, this was outside off. Beaten
plays and misses. Once again uncertainty resulting in a nervous poke to a full delivery moving away. Keeper collects it on the bounce
snakes a full-length delivery in towards the base of middle at 146kph, well kept out

beaten by one that holds its line after pitching just outside off. There was some noise but it may have been that of bat hitting the pad. Holder thinks of a review but decides against it. Replays suggest there was no edge, neither was the bat close to the pad.
scoots low to beat the bottom edge as he pokes away from the body.
beaten, hit on the pad as the incoming delivery deflects to the keeper as they squeeze in a leg-bye
floats this full on middle from wide of the crease, kept away
full and angling into leg stump, tucked away to short square leg
length ball angling in from wide of the crease, keeps a touch low, but he's solid in defence
gets on top of the bounce and guides this length ball towards backward point
beautiful drive. Shot of the afternoon. Not a genuine half-volley but he wasn't afraid to drive through the line on the up. Feet moved closer to the ball, he leant into it and just punched it away
pushes outside the line as the ball angles in late to roll off a thick inside edge to midwicket
back of length delivery outside off, left alone. Dowrich fails to gather it cleanly on the half-volley
full and just outside off, left alone
flicks this incoming delivery to midwicket
full and angling into middle and leg, he wrists this into the gap between square leg and midwicket
pokes and misses a delivery that holds its line
uppish but just short of the man coming in from short cover. Grips the surface and stops on him as he pushes forward
squared up by the length, gets a thick edge that flies between keeper and gully
this is full and honing in towards middle, defended back down the ground
flicked but all along the ground towards deep square leg
defends this full delivery with his bat close to the pad
prods forward and opens the bat face to guide this full delivery towards gully
full-length delivery on middle, slows it down this time, squeezed back to the bowler
back of length delivery on off from wide of the crease, punched to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
squeezes this yorker-length delivery outside off to mid-off
full and angling in towards the stumps, kept out as he offers a straight bat
overpitched and he comes forward to play a crashing drive between cover and point
chops this attempted cut to the cover fielder
firm push but can't pierce the gap, straight to mid-off
full on off stump, slight movement of the feet forward and defended
short on off stump, Ervine is quick to choose to duck under it but the ball barely goes over his head or even the stumps. Stays very low
back of a length on off stump, swivels and works off his hips towards short midwicket. Not the ideal contact with the bat, hits him near the sticker-area of the bat
overpitched outside off and drilled past extra cover for a well-timed boundary. In the slot to be hit, really. Hits it through the line of the ball
good length on middle, drifts onto his pads, clipped off his pads to square leg
back of a length on off stump, Moor uses the depth of the crease before defending this back to Holder
tossed up first ball, full on leg stump, tucked past Holder at midwicket. Gave the ball a big rip to begin his spell

crashes into middle stump! Flatter one this time, back of a length just outside off stump and turns into his body and goes between Ervine's bat and pad and the ball hits timber. Came onto the batsman very quickly and he was too slow to make the adjustment. Bishoo strikes second ball
full on middle and Raza tries to paddle this time, the ball sneaks under his bat and hits his pad in front of off. Big appeal from Bishoo and co, but not out. Replays suggest it hit him outside off
full on off, driven to cover
full just outside off, stays low as he lets the ball go through to Dowrich
full outside off again, Moor isn't enticed to play a big drive, chooses to leave it alone
back of a length just outside off, stays low as he defends this off his back foot. Goes deep into the crease
full outside off, pushed off the front foot past mid off's right for runs. Played on the up while walking down the wicket. Crisply timed
back of a length just outside off, stays low once again. Tries to poke at it but the ball goes under his blade and through to Dowrich
back of a length outside off, the wide release of the bowler angles the ball into him, defended off the back foot
short outside off, angles into the right hander. Defended off the back foot from near his chest
flicked fine off his legs and races away for four, full on middle but drifts down the leg side. Minimal touch off the bat, and runs fine past Dowrich's left. No stopping that one
full on off, pushed straight to short cover
drifts and lands full on middle, defended towards the fielder at short cover once again
back of a length just outside off, spins further away, left alone
full outside off, driven on the up towards cover once again
short outside off, stays low and cut square to extra cover
big stride forward and defended off the front foot. It was full outside off and he plays it from top of off stump
shuffles down the wicket and driven firmly. But straight to mid off. It was full just outside off
full and wide outside off, delivers the ball like an offcutter. The ball stays low and goes through to Dowrich after two bounces. The keeper can't collect, and hits him near his thighs.
punched off the back foot to cover, shuffles towards the leg side and offers the bat's full face
comes forward, bends his knee, and drives to cover. It's full outside off and not much trouble for Moor to play it
offcutter once again, back of a length outside off, left alone and carries well through to Dowrich
overpitched just outside off, tries to drive and misses it. Goes straight through to hit him on the pads, but no appeal from anyone. Hit him outside off
big stride forward and tapped back to Bishoo. Full on off stump and gets bat to ball before the cherry could deviate after pitching
driven on the up but takes the outside edge and flies towards point, full outside off and driven with intent
full outside off, spins further away, left alone by Raza
almost a yorker on off stump, tries to punch back past the bowler, but the bat turns. Mistimed to mid on
tossed up just outside off, Raza moves slightly to the leg side and drives towards cover. Straight to the fielder
back of a length outside off, backs away and cuts. Can't get the necessary direction to thread the needle. Straight to point
tossed up and it's a yorker on middle stump, hit back to Chase. Goes one-bounce to the bowler
back of a length on middle, the spin takes the ball down the leg side
full outside off stump, tapped back to Chase off the front foot
full on off, defended with the open face of the bat, goes behind square on the off side and second slip has to run behind it
tucked behind square on the leg side this time, goes deep into the crease and worked it off his hips to deep backward square
full on off stump, pushed to short cover off the front foot. There's spin on offer but nothing too wild from Chase
dances down and drives to wide long off, full outside off and played with the turn
tossed up wide outside off, big stride forward and hits the toe-end of the bat as he tries to carve this towards the off side
full on off, cut from close to his body towards point
it lobbed up, but safe in front of the batsman. Tossed up full on off and he played at it with hard hands, lucky that the edge did not go behind to the cordon
full outside off, another big step forward and defended
full just outside off, spins away from the right hander as he knocks the ball past cover's right
back of a length on off stump, goes deep into the crease and works this off his hips past short leg's right
quicker one this time, full on off stump, big step forward and takes the inside edge past short leg
back of a length on middle, turns further down the leg side. Sharp take from Dowrich
full outside off, opens the bat's face towards point with soft hands. Allows the batsmen to take the single
tossed up full on off stump, driven past the bowler to mid off's right
back of a length on middle, the turn takes the ball down the leg side once again. Cramps Raza slightly but does well to ensure the ball doesn't touch him as it goes past him
tossed up outside off, gives it a big rip, stays low and goes through to the keeper
flatter outside off, goes back and punches the ball off the back foot to extra cover
full on off stump, no spin this time as the ball goes straight, prods forward and defends
back of a length just outside off, minimal feet movement and tries to defend off the back foot. Takes the outside edge, and goes to first slip
full on off, defended with soft hands because there's silly point prowling
full on off stump, a big stride forward, defended once again off the front foot
short outside off, backs away towards the leg side and carves this in front of square on the leg side. Punched between cover and extra cover
back of a length outside off, stays low as the batsman tries to defend, barely takes the toe-end of the bat, and the ball sneaks past short leg
full outside off, prods forward and defends this with the bat's open face
back of a length just outside off, gets inside the line of the ball defending
back of a length outside off, quicker one, forcing the batsman to rock back and somehow get bat to ball
full on off stump, spins into his body and defended with soft hands. And that's tea.
touch short, he opens up the off side and cuts this to deep point
tossed up outside off, driven with the spin to long-off
drifts in a full delivery on middle, defended back to Bishoo
premeditated paddle, helped by the fact that the ball drifted back in a long way. Neatly done
got too close to this tossed up delivery as he looked to flick, almost yorked himself
slider outside off, he pads it away. Stifled appeal but impact outside the line
keeps low but this is at length on the stumps, defended back
punched into the gap at extra cover, they're back for the second quite comfortably
fired full on the stumps from wide of the crease, squeezed back towards the bowler
driven into the gap at extra cover for an easy single
pushed through quicker, this came back in sharply from off stump, bunted to short midwicket
fired into middle and leg, tucked to the leg side
drifting into middle from wide of the crease, Moor lunges forward and defends with the bat well in front of the pad
hint of turn away from off stump, defended with soft hands
slow turn from middle, worked against the turn towards midwicket
nice, loopy delivery on off stump. Raza gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin
slider on off stump, this keeps a touch low. Raza somehow manages to keep that out. Scooted on
muscled one bounce into the midwicket boundary. This was a long hop that deserved to be put away
flatter delivery on middle, punched back to the bowler
nice flight, lands this way outside off, drags this straight hit on the bounce towards long-on
fired full and straight on the stumps, blocked
full and sliding into middle and leg, squeezed to short midwicket
too short, he rocks back and slaps this into the point boundary. That is another poor delivery, giving the batsman too much time to open up the off side to put it away
slow turn from outside off, defended with soft hands
driven with the spin to short cover
too full and angling into middle, squeezed back to the bowler
driven with the spin to extra cover
slow turn from outside off, left alone
too much flight, he gets right to the pitch of the ball and laces this to the cover boundary. Gorgeous
prods forward and squeezes this full delivery
slider outside off, dabs this to cover and looks for a single, but is sent back. There's a direct hit from cover courtesy Shai Hope but Raza is just in
tossed up outside off, eased down to long-off for an easy single
fired full on the stumps from wide of the crease, turned to the leg side
eased against the turn to extra cover. Too much flight
fired on middle and leg, squeezed to midwicket
slow turn from outside off, he makes a bit of room and punches this to deep extra cover
spins away from off stump, Raza plays a risky little paddle towards fine leg
drifting into middle, Raza gets a good stride forward and blocks
stretches forward and dabs this gently to the off side
muscled over long-on. Too much flight, his eyes lit up as he got to the pitch of the ball and hammered this against the turn. Ensured he got as close to the ball as possible
slaps this cut to short cover
keeps a touch low, he looks to force this through cover but mistimes it
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases this full delivery to cover
too full, he lunges forward and squeezes this back down the pitch
fired full on the stumps, blocked
slow turn back into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, defended gently to the leg side
attacks the stumps by darting this full and flat, defended back to the bowler
driven with the spin to wide long-off as they jog the single
tossed up outside off, Raza gets to the pitch of the ball and smothers the spin
gets forward, then has to reach out just a little more as he drives to cover
drifts this in towards off, gets the ball to break away as Raza blocks
rocks back and cuts to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
full on the stumps, bunted to the off side

full outside off, driven on the up and takes the outside edge. Falls just short of the diving fielder at gully. Pushed at that delivery and the ball straightened after pitching, thereby inducing the edge
overpitched just outside off stump, prods forward and defends tentatively
short outside off, goes straight through to the keeper with the batsman shouldering his arms
full outside off, stays very low this time. The batsman is not interested to offer any shot to that
full on off stump, punched down the ground to mid off after a big stride ahead
back of a length on off stump, tapped towards the leg side off the back foot
pitched full on middle, paddled fine on the leg side down on one knee. Played softly enough to allow the batsmen to get more than one
good-length ball that stays low, but Raza bends his knee, get his centre of gravity much lower, and then slogs it square on the leg side. Races past backward square for a boundary
back of a length just outside off, spins away from him, left alone
back of a length outside off, shoulders his arms
full outside off, drifted this time. Defended with soft hands with a big stride forward
back of a length just outside off, waits for the ball to come to him and cut square past point for an easy run
yorker on off stump, Raza does well to get his toes out of the way before wedging his bat down just in tie. Well bowled
back of a length outside off, gets inside the line of the delivery and punched off the back foot to the bowler
back of a length on middle and off, tucked towards the square-leg umpire on the leg side, but not with the contact he was looking for. Midwicket runs forward and stops the single
pitches it short, and Raza was expecting the ball to fly over his head. It doesn't, stays low outside off and the batsman manages to get bat to ball from just outside off
good length on middle, worked off his hips to fine leg for a run
short outside off, angles into his body. The delivery gets big on Moor, but he defends from chest high with soft hands
starts off with a short-pitched delivery, lands on off stump and angles into Raza's body. Tiptoed and defended
back of a length outside off, opens the bat's face and pushes towards the off side. Point races to his right and stops it
back of a length outside off, stays low as the ball is blocked off the back foot
full and drifting onto his pads this time, flicked off his toes to midwicket
goes short once again, doesn't get the bounce he was searching for. Defended off the back foot through to Gabriel
back of a length outside off, goes deep into the popping crease and punches it off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, pushed back to Holder with ease
back of a length outside off, prods forward to defend and takes the inside edge off the bat through to his front pad. Holder wanted to appeal for the lbw, but realises that there's an edge

could be close! Slower ball outside off and Moor opens the bat's face and sends it past point's right, he calls for two, and the fielder does well to throw it flat at the striker's end. Moor has to dive, and he barely makes it in before Dowrich dislodges the bails
overpitched on middle, clipped off his toes to square leg. The batsman was falling over his shot there
full just outside off, bunted back to Holder. Tried to tap this past the bowler, but mistimed
defended with the bat's full face, it's a full-pitched ball outside off and Moor deals with it off the front foot
bends his back to pitch this short outside off, Raza bends backwards to avoid the short ball
short outside off once again, Raza does not move this time though. Just lets the ball go past him from near his eye-line
attempted yorker, eventually a full toss on middle, punched back to Gabriel off the front foot
full outside off, keeps the bat's face opened and defends it towards point

full on middle and leg, the batsman tries to flick this off his toes but misses the shot. Hits him on the pads and Gabriel is appealing for the leg before. It was going down leg stump, but Gabriel is distraught
full once again, pitches on middle and leg and is going down Raza's leg side. A very good take from Dowrich, who throws himself to his left to pocket the ball
back of the hand slower ball this time, almost delivers it like a leg cutter (99kph), the batsman is through his drive too early, takes the inside edge and the ball pings away towards the leg side
full on off stump, punched down the ground to mid off
tries the leg cutter once again, doesn't have the direction this time. It's overpitched outside off and the batsman is in no mood to engage with that delivery
full on middle, tapped fine down the leg side, they walk through for the single

goes for the slower ball once again, it's full outside off and left alone. Holder's trying to release this off the back of his hand, and spinning further away from the right hander, almost as if it was Bishoo bowling. An interesting choice of delivery
back of a length outside off, pokes at the ball and keeps it down off the back foot
quick to start the over, good length outside off, Moor doesn't engage with that delivery. Lets it go through
back of a length outside off, angling into the batsman's body. Defended off the front foot towards point
short outside off, extravagantly attempts to cut this, but the ball flies over his swinging blade
very full outside off, Moor tries to drive this time but Gabriel is too quick for that. Bowls it at 149kph (yes, you read that right) and Moor was too late to make any contact
full outside off, left alone
full on middle, angles down the leg side with Moor offering no shot
full outside off, stays low and left alone
full on middle, walks down and drives past cover's right for a four, full face of the bat offered
full on off, driven off the back foot to the bowler
back of a length outside off, shoulders his arms. The ball tailed slightly in after going past Raza
full on off stump, comes inside the line of the ball and taps it to mid on's left
full outside off, stays low as the ball goes through to Dowrich. Very uneven bounce
back of a length outside off, tapped back to Gabriel off the front foot. No real lateral movement to bother the set Moor
back of a length wide outside off, enough width for a loose shot, but chooses not to be tempted by the room. Shoulders his arms
back of a length outside off, slightly slower ball this time, Moor pushes at the ball with stiff hands and it lobs up before falling a few feet in front of point
it's full outside off, forcing the batsman to drive. Misses it once again.
back of a length outside off, almost no bounce after hitting the deck, goes through to Dowrich after bouncing twice. Left alone by Moor
yorker on off stump, gets his toes out of the way and squeezes it towards short cover
angles in a back of length delivery on the stumps, solidly defended
slides a length delivery into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
late reverse back in from wide of the crease, almost yorker length. Raza manages to keep that out
short of length ball that keeps a touch low around off stump, carefully defended
chops this cut to cover. Not much room, he was beaten for pace as well
floats this slower delivery outside off, watched through to the keeper
gentle dibbly-dobbly length ball on off, defended to cover
angles in a full delivery on middle and leg, defended back down the pitch
tails in a full ball on the stumps, squeezed back down the pitch
right to the pitch of the ball as he drives to sweeper cover
gets across the stumps and whips this short of length delivery off his hips to deep square leg
leans forward and bunts this juicy full toss straight to cover. Scoring opportunity missed. Little more power and better placement, and it would've been four.
in-dipper from length outside off, Raza defends from the crease
defends this incoming delivery with the bat close to the pad
plants his front foot outside the line of the stumps and defends
slower and fuller outside off, Raza looks to drive but realises this is far too wide for him to have anything to do with the delivery. Left alone
shows the full face of the bat in defence of that incoming length delivery
off-cutter which he dabs gently, the ball rolls behind the stumps but not as close as Raza anticipated. He quickly turned back to kick it away but realised it wasn't anywhere close to danger
flays this short of length delivery straight to point
gets forward properly and squeezes this full delivery to the off side
full-length outside off, laced to extra cover
right forward to the full delivery as he blocks
drives this full delivery straight to extra cover
floats this full length delivery on middle, defends with the bat well in front of the pad
length ball sliding into middle and leg, tucked into the gap between square leg and midwicket
length on off, he gets a good stride forward and bunts it gently
tails in a full delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, squeezed off a thick inside edge to mid-on
off-cutter coming in from outside off, Raza shoulders arms
right to the pitch of the ball as he defends
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks
cut away to the deep point boundary, straight to the boundary rider
driven through the line to deep extra cover
leading edge that rolls to mid-off. Looked to flick and closed the bat face too early
driven firmly but can't pierce the packed off side ring
came back in a long way from outside off, tucked away with the angle towards fine leg. Scores level
punches this length ball to cover
wayward delivery sliding down leg, too far down to get a tickle. Good work by the keeper
angling in from wide of the crease, defends this gently
floats this full but the angle is taking it in towards off stump, he plants forward and outside the line of the stumps as he defends

keeps this flick down and all along the ground to ease this wide of mid-on to bring up his sixth Test fifty. Second of the match. He's had to curb his natural game, has played the situation perfectly. Hasn't been frustrated over long periods when runs didn't come. Now to carry on till stumps
full and nipping back in from outside off, left alone
turns this incoming length delivery towards midwicket
whips this full delivery to midwicket. Slightly overbalanced as he played it
short and sliding into middle and leg, keeps a touch low. He looks to whip this past square leg but the ball slid in to deflect off the pad to short fine
short of length outside off, there's a temptation to cut, but he's happy to leave
full and straight outside off, squeezed to mid-off
nicely behind the line of this incoming length ball as he blocks
turns this gentle length delivery to the leg side
full and tailing in from wide of the crease, squeezed back to the bowler
full and angling into the pads, he's perfectly balanced as he flicks to deep midwicket
shows the full face of the bat in defence
squared up by this slightly fuller delivery but he manages to somehow keep that out
floats this full on off stump, defended towards cover
back of length delivery coming into middle, blocked
full outside off, defended
back of a length outside off, nudged to point. Raza wants the single, but he's sent back
back of a length just outside off, carved away to point
very full outside off, the batsman misses the drive and a sharp take from Dowrich
back of a length outside off stump, punched off the back to cover
quicker one to end the over, full outside off and left alone
tossed up outside off, spins into his bat's blade as he defends off the front foot
pushed wide outside off, tapped to extra cover
pitched full on off stump again, blocked off the front foot
slower one this time, full on off, defended with soft hands
full on off, bunted to wide mid off
very full outside off, big stride forward and defended towards the off side
full on middle, walks across and nudges it to backward square off the back foot
wide outside off, pushed away from his body past point's right to the sweeper-fielder positioned in the deep
full outside off, driven straight to the fielder in the deep on the off side. Only one man sweeping that region, and the ball is pinged straight to him
back of a length outside off, stayed back waiting for the ball to come onto him. Defended off the back foot
quicker one, almost a yorker on middle. Squeezed away towards short cover
pitched full on off, driven back to Blackwood, who does well to hold on to the ball on his followthrough
full just outside off, punched off the front foot past the bowler to long off for one
back of a length just outside off, defended off the front foot
tossed up just outside off, pushed past the non-striker to long on off the front foot
back of a length outside off, tries to work this off his hips behind square on the leg side. Goes straight to square leg instead
overpitched outside off, bunted back to Brathwaite
full outside off once again, Raza looks to drive but is through his shot slightly early. Adjusts and waits for it to come towards him, before tapping it towards cover
gives the ball a rip outside off, spins further away, left alone
full on off stump, driven through the ball's line. Dribbles away to long off
back of a length on middle, goes straight through this time. Defended off the back foot
big stride forward to negate the spin off the pitch, defended from top of off stump
low full toss on middle, muscled past midwicket's right for a run
flighted this one to end the over, pitches full outside off, and the batsman brings out the square drive. Moor will keep the strike
full outside off, regular offspin into his body, carved  away towards cover
full on off this time, prods forward and pushes the ball back to Brathwaite
good length, pitches on middle, worked off his hips past midwicket's right. Calls early for the single, they realise there's a second run possible, and they scamper through for the double
good length on off stump, flicked off his pads towards square leg off the back foot
full on off stump, displays the full face of the bat in his defense
back of a length outside off, pushed back to Brathwaite
pitched up on middle stump, defended off the front foot
sharp legspin! full on middle and spins away from Raza's bat. He adjusts and makes contact though
short outside off, waits for it and cuts square past point and cover
tossed up full outside off, spins further away. Left alone by Moor
full on middle and leg, nudged fine behind down the leg side. Bishoo thought he had gotten pad to it. Chose to appeal
flatter one to end the day, full on off stump and blocked by Raza. That's stumps.
starts off with a short one, it's wide outside off, left alone
full on middle, punched off the front foot to mid on
big step forward and defended off the front foot. It was full outside off.
tails in after pitching on a good length outside off, Moor gets his bat out of the way
pushed off the front foot to short cover, back of a length outside off and Moor was quick to judge the length
first runs, tacked behind to deep backward square, full on middle and a simple flick of the wrists is all Moor employed
back of a length outside off, opens the bat's face and taps it to point
back of a length outside off, gets inside the line of the ball and punched off the back foot
played away from his body to this short ball from outside off, pokes at it and sends it past second slip
bends his back and pitches it short on off stump, Raza does well to get his bat near his face and playing it down. That no ball is a biggie, definitely the biggest of the Test. Heck, the series
tucks the short ball to midwicket, had to get onto his toes to play that shot, it pitched on off and got big on Moor, this one was a no ball as well, according to the replay, but the umpire missed it

short outside off once again, Moor tries to poke at it, but this time gully has come next to second slip. Straight to Shai Hope, who is on his knees as he tries to complete the catch. The umpires check for the no ball (duh) but Gabriel is good this time. The perfect start for WI, and these two miss out on a 100-run partnership

it's in the air again! But falls behind the square-leg umpire, fine leg runs to his left and keeps it from crossing the boundary. It was a slower delivery, full on middle, and Waller was through his flick way too soon
good length on off stump, driven back to Roach
back of a length outside off, Raza shoulders his arms and the ball tails in after crossing the batsman

back of a length outside off again, but swings into Raza's body and he tries to punch this off the back foot, but there's some extra bounce this time, and the ball cuts the batsman's shot in half. Big gap between bat and pad, and takes the inside edge and flies past Dowrich down the leg side. First boundary of the day
full outside off, gets inside the line of the ball and defended
full outside off, left alone, good carry to Dowrich

good length outside off, and it stays low this time! Raza is hurried into the defense, and takes the top of his pad and through to Dowrich. A tiny gap between the bat that's coming down and the pads. Not out for the lbw/caught behind, but Holder reviews. No bat, and the impact for the lbw was outside off stump. The umpire's decision stays
edged, and falls just short of first slip! Full just outside off, tries to drive and takes the outside of the bat. Drops a few feet ahead of Kyle Hope
full outside off, driven on the up, the bat turns in his hands, and the shot goes square, point scampers to his right and slides in to stop the double
back of a length outside off, straightens after pitching and well defended off the back foot
short outside off, goes through to Dowrich. Good carry
and this time it stays low, pitched slightly fuller outside off, and the ball barely bounces as it goes through to Dowrich. The keeper does well to get his body behind the ball
full on off and late tail into the batsman, tapped to mid on off the front foot
it's full and wide and driven extravagantly between point and cover, steps forward and plays it on the half volley
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
good length wide outside off, angles into Waller but not enough, goes past the outside of off stump as the batsman defends this over the ball. Stays low once again
more uneven bounce, full on middle and Waller tries to shuffle across to the off side to flick this off his pads. Smacks him on the pads, but would've gone down leg. Stays very low again
very wide outside off, but it's a full-pitched delivery that remains low as it goes through to Dowrich
short outside off, tries to cut this in front of square but mistimed. Straight to short cover
full on middle and leg, goes down the leg side and Dowrich dives full length to hold onto that
toe-crushing yorker on off stump, Raza does extremely well to get his bat down, and importantly his toes away, in time
goes short this time, wide outside off and good carry through to the keeper
full outside off, carved towards cover point off the front foot
back of a length outside off and Raza shoulders his arms. Before letting the ball go, though, he ensured he covered the front of off stump. Late tail in and goes just past the outside of off stump
full on middle, pushed to mid on off the front foot
short outside off, gets his bat outside off stump and plays it with soft hands. Played very far away from his body
full on off, worked off his hips past square leg for a couple. Just past the umpire's right
driven straight to cover, full outside off. Nice connection off the bat, but nowhere near the gap
back of a length outside off, tries to flick but misses the shot. Hits his pad outside off
full on middle, drifts into his pads and tries to play this towards fine leg, misses the bat and hits his pad, big appeal for lbw, but turned down. Would've gone down leg with that extra drift
stays full again, full on off and Raza comes forward to push at it, takes the inside edge and flies away towards midwicket
full on middle, turned down the leg side using his wrists, there's a deep fine leg though
full on leg, and going further down leg side. Dowrich does really well to dive to his left and pocket the ball inside his gloves. Saves the byes for certain
full on middle, worked off his pads past midwicket for a quick run
driven through the ball's line but not off the middle of the bat, the ball was pitched full outside off, and hit straight to mid off
full on off stump, angles into the batsman and firmly defended off the front foot

in the air! But just goes past the right of the fielder at short point. It was short outside off and stayed lower than expected. The batsman poked at it, and the ball lobbed away to the off side. Gabriel is on his knees
full outside off, driven straight back to the bowler
full outside off, big stride forward and blocked
full outside off, firmly driven to mid off. Shouts of 'catch it' but the ball fell some distance in front of the fielder
back of a length outside off, slightly comes in after pitching but defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, shoulders his arms as the ball goes through to Dowrich at a comfortable height
slower ball to end the over, back of a length outside off and defended with soft hands from in front of offs stump
full outside leg, trying to use the rough developed in that area, defended off the front foot
shorter on leg stump, Raza backs away and muscles this towards deep midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, eventually a full toss, pushes it to midwicket for a quick run
good length outside off, spins further away and Waller cuts it square. Dribbles away to point
good length outside off, waits for it this time and carves it square to point
full toss on middle and log, tries to heave this towards the leg side, but mistimed. Goes straight past the non-striker to mid on
short on off, doesn't have the pace off the pitch to worry Raza, worked behind square on the leg side off his hips
full outside off, pushed to point who tries to field it but over runs, has to chase back. Concedes the extra run
good length on middle, drifts onto his pads and hits him in front of leg stump. Would've gone down
full on middle, uses his wrists to flick this to square leg for a quick run
full on middle and the extra drift in helps Raza to turn this towards fine leg once again
back of a length outside off, pushed to short cover with ease
full outside leg stump, Raza gets a big stride forward and defended
gives this one a rip, full on leg stump, tries to defend this off the front foot, takes the outside edge and goes past first slip along the ground. There's a fielder at third man
full on middle and leg, forces Waller to defend
full just outside leg stump, defended with the full face of the bat
full on middle and Waller drives with the turn, straight to mid off
good length on middle, worked off his hips to short fine leg
short on off stump, stay slow and hits him on the pads on middle stump, big appeal for lbw, but might still have been high
full on off, punched off the front foot to mid on
full on off stump, flicked off his pads to midwicket, came inside the line of the ball and worked this square
full on middle, defends but takes the inside edge towards square leg
pitched up outside off, squeezed away. Waller falls over while playing that shot, perhaps playing too early
full on off, steps forward and blocks. And the second new ball is now due.
full on middle, closes the bat's face and turns this towards the leg side
full on leg, flicked past square leg, good use of the wrists to play this behind square and to work against the legspin
full on leg, tried to defend with the straight bat, but the ball pings away past silly point
and the field placement works! back of a length on middle and Waller tries to push at it away from his body, takes the outside edge and Blackwood at slip takes a simple one
full on middle, the new man in goes deep into the crease and defends
tossed up full on leg stump, defended with the bat's closed face towards the leg side
back of a length outside off, nudged to point. Raza says no to the run
131kph this time, pitches full outside off and tails into Raza's body as he steps forward and shoulders his arms. Goes just past his front pad and through to Dowrich
good length on middle, displays the full face of the bat to defend off the front foot
full on off stump, driven to mid on. Shuffled across to the off side to get inside the line of the ball before playing this down the ground
full on off stump, punched back to Holder. The bowler does well to get down on his followthrough and grab onto that
back of a length on off stump, delivers this from wide of the crease and the ball drifts onto his pads, turned to deep fine leg
driven past cover's right, it was full outside off and played away from his body, could've been a boundary, but wide long off does well to cut it off
full on middle, defended
full on middle and pushes Chakabva deep into his crease, flies past his outside edge to Dowrich
full on middle, and stays very low as the ball goes through to Dowrich past the off stump. Chakabva has no clue
full outside leg and the batsman pads it in front of middle. Big appeal for lbw before the bowler realised that it pitched outside leg
back of length just around off, defended gently to the off side
full and just outside off, Raza plants outside the line and defends
angles in a full ball just around off, Raza overbalanced as he defends. Was initially looking to work this through the leg side
solid defence again. Gets a long way forward as he shifts across the stumps and blocks. So forward that he can smell leather
hops back to work this to the leg side but the ball lobs off the leading edge to the off side. Short of the bowler on his followthrough
thick inside edge onto the pad as he pushes outside the line of this length ball
squeezes this in-drifter to the off side. Almost yorker-length
beauty. Drifts in, grips the rough and spins across the face of the bat. Beaten
tossed up from wide of the crease, Chakabva lunges forward and smothers the spin
slider outside off, the trajectory is much flatter, left alone
left alone because of sharp turn again
goes back and across as he bunts this sharp-spinning delivery to the off side

yes, reverse swing to the fore. Raza goes a long way across to work this incoming length ball to the leg side. He's struck on the thigh pad and at the point of impact, leg stump was visible. Both feet were in the air when he looked to glance this fine. The umpire took a long time to lift his finger. Raza reviewed immediately, but he isn't the tallest batsman. But Hawkeye indicates it would've just missed leg. Raza survives
nervous fish outside off to a delivery that holds its line. Wasn't far from the edge. He's bowling superbly here
squeezes this incoming full-length delivery to the off side
full-length on middle from wide of the crease, worked to the leg side

nastly blow on the knee, is it? Raza is hobbling. This in-dipper hit him on the inside of his pad as he looked to negotiate it. He was initially looking to leave it but the angle mean he had to try and play it. The impact of the blow just above his knee threw him off balance as well.
shows the full face of the bat to keep out this length ball.
off the mark as he clips a leg-stump half-volley into the gap at midwicket
lunges forward to defend but the ball spins away sharply to whizz past the outside edge
nice flight, just outside off, defended with soft hands

rocks back and slaps this away. Shai Hope, at silly point, is hit on the shin pad as he looks to take evasive action. He was watching the ball all along instead of turning his back on the delivery.Good technique
tossed up on off stump from around the stumps, he lunges forward and smothers the spin
sharp turn from way outside off, the angle taking it away further. He lets it go
angles in a length ball towards middle, defended gently. The bowler was caught napping on his followthrough. The ball was no more than a few yards to his right, but they manage to steal a single
fumble by the keeper gives them a bye. He let go this length ball that pounded into the keeper's knee as he tried to stop it on the half-volley
works this incoming length ball awkwardly off his hip towards midwicket
gets outside the line of the stumps and keeps out this full delivery
full length outside off, left alone
rolls off a thick inside edge towards square leg. Played outside the line largely because he was uncertain which way the ball would wobble after pitching
drives this full delivery to mid-off
tossed up outside leg from around the stumps, he pads it away
too much flight, lands this on off, negotiated with ease
just eludes midwicket. Too short, he rocks back and pulls this in front of square.
nice and full on leg stump, plants towards the delivery and blocks
another short ball, another pull, another four, another one towards midwicket. Long hop, he picked the length early, transferred his weight back and walloped it away
steers this back of length delivery to point
gets forward and bunts this to short cover for a single, there is a wild throw however at the bowler's end from Blackwood. Powell is unable to back up, so what should've been one is now five
floats this full outside off, left alone
slants in a full ball on off stump, defends
shows the full face of the bat in defense
nice and full, just outside off, Chakabva is right to the pitch of the ball as he blocks
full and just outside off from wide of the crease, he stretches forward and defends
squared up by this incoming delivery which pitches on off and straightens, but he somehow manages to get plenty of bat in his forward defence
punched off the backfoot to deep point
gets this full delivery to nip away off the seam from outside off, he shoulders arms
uncertainty. Should I leave? Should I play? 'Okay, let me hang bat out and then withdraw as it comes in.' Rolls off the thick outside edge to second slip.
defends this incoming length delivery from the crease
flicks this juicy full toss on leg stump towards deep midwicket. Neatly done
flicks this against the turn to wide mid-on as they scamper a quick single
cut away but can't pick the gap at point
pads it away. This was landed well outside leg, so it didn't matter if the ball would've gone on to hit
gets a long way forward and bunts this in-drifter to the leg side
goes back and across as he works this sharp-spinning leg break towards short leg
back of length delivery outside off, he stands tall and defends
beaten. This full delivery moves away just a bit, Raza reaches out to drive without any feet movement. Quickly realises it was a terrible shot to play.
full and swinging away from well outside off, left alone again
drawn forward by this full delivery, plays it with soft hands and gets this into the gap between slip and gully. Brathwaite comes around from deep backward point to cut that off
ripper of a delivery, a yorker right into the base of middle, Raza just about manages to dig that out
shows the full face of the bat to keep out this length delivery on off. It's lunch on the final day.
full and wide outside off, there's an open invitation to drive, but he lets it go instead
gets this length ball to angle in and holds its line from just outside off, Chakabva shoulders arms
short of length delivery outside off, Chakabva gets on top of the bounce to fend but lets it go in the end
slips in a superb yorker to try and catch the batsman off guard but he's alert and manages to squeeze it out
full and angling away from outside off, watched through to the keeper again
gets this full ball to nip back in off the seam from outside off, left alone again
works this length ball from middle to long leg, 200 up for Zimbabwe

the man at short mid-on is caught napping as they steal a single despite Chakabva being deep inside his crease as he defended that. Blackwood was just a split-second late, tried to tip it off his boot to the stumps at the bowler's end
too short and sliding into the pads, worked wide of midwicket. They want a second but can't get it this time
too straight and he's clipped that to deep backward square leg.
this in-dipper scoots low, batsman leaves, keeper attempts to stop it but can't. Beats everyone to the boundary. More frustration for West Indies
full and angling in from wide of the crease, defended gently down the ground with soft hands
whips this incoming length ball towards fine leg. The man there had some work to do, by which time Raza was comfortably back for the second

that's the end of that. A century eludes him and Holder lets out a roar. He's breached his defence with a stunning delivery. Length ball that jags back in from off stump, Raza plays forward but makes the mistake of picking the wrong line as the ball sneaks in to beat the inside edge and flatten the off stump. Holder goes off on a celebratory run. A wicket well-deserved. That's a dagger through Zimbabwe's hearts. Raza has to walk back shortly after becoming only the second player in Test history, after Kallis, to score successive 80s and a Test five-for in the same game.

that's a snorter of a bouncer, West Indies can't review because they have none left. Cremer drops his wrists to get out of the way of that ripper of a delivery. He's got a big, fat glove on the way through as the ball also deflects off the shoulder. . Dowrich, who leaps high, holds on to the second attempt. Oh, dear. Umpire Simon Fry has missed that
firm drive to mid-off
full and sliding in, prods forward and keeps that out
in-ducker from outside, left alone
short ball outside off, Chakabva sways out of the way
helps this incoming delivery down to fine leg. Ball deflects off the thigh pad, replays confirm
back of length delivery outside off, this one straightens, and he lets it go
caresses this firmly into the gap between cover and point. This was bowled at 147kph
gets half a stride in as he defends this incoming length ball with his bat close to the pad. This one cranked up at 141kph
ripper of a delivery. Right into the stumps, yorker-length, kept out
short ball on the body from wide of the crease, Cremer ducks under it
full and just outside off, watched through to the wicketkeeper
away-swinger from outside off, there is an opportunity to drive, but Cremer doesn't it the bait
shapes to drive, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
gets forward and gently defends
crisp straight drive but well stopped by Holder on his followthrough
floats a full delivery, but outside off, left alone
squirts this full delivery that leaves him late towards third man. A proper dash from Shimron Hetmyer, but he may have just touched the advertising skirtings while pulling the ball back in
snakes in a full length delivery from wide of the crease, Chakabwa plays it back down the pitch
dabs this incoming length ball with soft hands to the off side
full and straight on the stumps, squeezed to the leg side
right behind the line of the ball as he defends back down the pitch
full and drifts down leg side, turned off his hips to fine leg for a run. Zimbabwe closing in on the 100-run lead
back of a length outside off, prods forward and defends
pitched short on off stump, sends Chakabva ducking for cover
goes short once more, not as much bounce this time but still well directed. Forces the batsman do defend off the back foot

short, but not enough bounce! Tries to duck under this but the ball hits his body instead. Just near the collar bone as the batsman stay down on one knee. Looks like a bad blow, but Chakabva holds his ground. Big appeal for lbw, however: it struck him in front of middle, but would've gone over the stumps
short on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on middle, pushed off his toes to midwicket
short outside off, stays low but goes straight through to Dowrich
back of a length outside off, goes deep into the crease and defends
good length just outside off, angles into Cremer, punched off the back foot
full on middle, clipped off his toes to square leg. Straight to the fielder
back of a length outside off, stays low as Cremer shoulders his arms
full just outside off, defended with soft hands off the front foot. Takes bat-pad and the ball settles near his toes

full on middle, played square on the leg side off his hips. Can't play it as fine as he wants to because of the fielder at leg slip. They call early for the two, and it might've been trouble at the striker's end if the throw had more power
short on middle, turned fine down the leg side. Dribbles away to the fielder at leg slip
sticks to short once again, flicked off his hips to deep fine leg off the back foot
short outside off, forces Cremer to tiptoe. Defend off the back foot from near his chest
short on off stump, angles into Cremer's body. Firmly defended off the back foot
full outside off, straightens after pitching. Left alone. Enough width to play a shot over the off side, but Chakabva chooses to be patient
full on off stump, driven to mid on. Crisply hit but the fielder did not have to move too much to gather that
full on middle, pushed past the bowler off the front foot and mid on races to his left and dives to stop the ball from going past the infield
short outside off, angled into the batsman's body. Blocked off the back foot with soft hands to keep the ball down
full outside off, tries to defend and takes the outside edge past the non-existent slip cordon for more runs. Short third man has to give it a chase
back of a length outside off, stays slightly low as Chakabva looks to poke at it, but eventually pulls his bat back. Straight to Dowrich
full on middle, pushed straight on the leg side but short mid on stops it from going past him
full on middle and leg, driven towards midwicket on the up. He was falling over that shot after playing
tossed up outside off stump, tapped down the ground to long on for a single
back of a length outside off, spins in sharply off the deck, goes deep into the crease and defended
big step forward and negates this ball outside off, it's full and Cremer keeps his bat close to his pad and defends
short on middle and spins further away from the batsman. He had already backed away to cut this and manages to play the shot off his toe end, goes to deep extra cover
good length on middle, carved away towards point
full on middle, smothers the turn and defended
full just outside leg, pads it
full on middle, big legspin away from the batsman. Left alone
bowls on target this time, full on leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, Cremer backs away and muscles this towards midwicket off the back foot
full on off stump, almost a yorker. Squeezed back to Chase
full on middle, worked away off the back foot to square leg
good length on middle and too much turn this time, goes down Cremer's leg side
adjusts his line this time, good length just outside off, defended off the front foot
full on middle, tapped back with the straight bat to Chase
shapes to cut but this kept a touch low, chops the cut to short cover
nice and fully forward as he smothers the spin
gets a good stride forward and blocks
excellent stop at cover, punched to Blackwood
slow turn from middle, forced to cover
squeezes this full delivery back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, spins into his body, goes back and defends

full outside off, big step forward and attempts the defense. The ball spins past his bat's inside edge and hits his front pad. Big appeal, but turned down. Once again, would've probably gone down leg. West Indies don't have a review either
full on off stump, tapped down the ground to long on, they walk across for the single
good length outside off, turns much lesser than the batsman expects. He looks to defend, and it takes the outside edge of his bat and past first slip
full on off stump, prods forward and defends off the front foot
no shot offered by Cremer, short on middle and the turn takes the down the leg side. Sharp take by Dowrich
full outside off stump, driven off the front foot past Bishoo's left, but the bowler does well to stop it from going through

induces the edge, and dropped! Full on off, and straightens after pitching, takes a thick outside edge off the bat, and hits the keeper's gloves, falls just where first slip was standing, but the fielder at slip had moved to his left expecting the catch and not the deflection off Dowrich's glove. Bishoo ain't pleased
short on off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
short on off stump, spins further away and left alone
good length just outside off, goes straight through as Cremer tentatively lets the ball go through
full on leg stump, batsman comes forward to defend but the ball hits him near his thigh pad. Appeal for lbw turned down
good length on middle, backs away and taps this past short leg

The non-striker's stumps are broken! It was full outside off and Chakabva smashes this down the ground. Chase gets his fingertips to it, and the stumps break. They're checking for the run out, but Cremer did really well to get his back leg in.
good length on middle, turned off his hips to short fine leg
good length on middle, tucked with the turn off his hips past square leg, midwicket has to give it a chase
good length on middle, goes straight through this time. Cremer uses the depth of the crease to play at this. Defended
back of a length outside off, effortlessly punched off the back foot towards mid off
very full on off stump, almost a yorker, and dug out well by the batsman. Dribbles through to long off
full outside off, carved in front of square on the off side, deep extra cover has to run to his right to retrieve that
short on off stump, waits for the ball to turn further away allowing him to free his arms, cut towards deep midwicket
full on middle and leg, sharp turn across the face of the bat and hits him on his back leg in front of off stump. They appeal for the lbw but the umpire says no
full on off stump, big step forward and defended, but takes the outside edge. Flies past first slip's right
back of a length on off stump, tries to work this square off his hips, but manages to play this straight to short fine leg
good length on middle, plays it much squarer this time, waits for the ball to come onto him and tucked off his pads past the square-leg umpire
full on middle, big step forward from Cremer, and defended easily
good length on leg stump, Cremer goes deep to defend but the ball smacks his pad after staying low. But would've gone down leg stump
full on middle, prods forward and blocks it this time
tossed up for the last ball, driven down the ground and Chase does well on his follow through to pick it up and stop the run
full outside off, gives the ball a big rip but Chakabva is up to the challenge. Smothers the spin with his soft-handed defense
good length on middle, uses his wrists to flick this past midwicket
full outside off, Cremer chases the ball with his pads but the ball spins further away from his feet. Dowrich collects
flighted up outside off, and a big drive from Cremer. Straight to cover however
back of a length just outside off, Cremer shuffles to the off side and punches the ball back to Bishoo
full outside off, Cremer gets his big stride forward and stays there as the ball spins past his boot and through to Dowrich. No shot offered
good length on off stump, the set batsman can easily defend this off the back foot.
lunges forward and defends off the front foot. It was full on middle, and fends it back to the bowler
good length on off stump, spins into his body, tucked fine down the leg side, but there's the man at short fine leg
another lunge forward to the full-pitched ball on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler
full on middle stump, comes forward and blocks

shouts of catch it, but there's no bat involved. Good length on middle, and the ball hits Chakabva's front leg before lobbing up to short leg. The infielders appeal, but the umpire reckons there's no bat on that
yorker on middle stump, gets his toes out of the way and gets his bat down just in time
full on middle once again, much better looking shot from the batsman this time. Defended off the front foot
good length outside off, stays low and Cremer manages to punch this to cover
ripper outside off, but Cremer lunges forward and defends off the front foot. Bat-pad there
good length outside off, Cremer chooses to cut square, but takes the toe end of the bat. Goes nowhere
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot in front of square. But straight to short mid on
too short, and walloped. Opens up the leg side by using the depth of the crease as he pulls this into the deep backward square leg fence
nice and full on middle and leg, blocked
goes back into the crease and turns this flatter delivery with the spin towards short leg
worked with the spin to backward square leg
tickles the pad and races away past short fine leg. Looks like there may have been some bat as well. In fact off the face
smothers the spin by getting a long way forward
spins away from outside off, left alone
